## Department Description
All 4 is Channel 4’s video-on-demand proposition, home to original and exclusive shows, box sets of iconic series, as well as live and catch up TV from C4’s broadcast channels.

Available as an app on over 20 different platforms including mobiles, tablets, PCs, smart TVs, and games consoles, as well as being syndicated to the likes of Sky and Virgin, All 4 reaches 3.5 million weekly viewers and has more than two thirds of all 16-34s in the UK as registered users.

The All 4 UX team is responsible for creating the best possible user experience on owned-and-operated platforms, one that is both seamless and engaging, and that encourages visitors to become viewers, to view more, and to return more often.

## Job Purpose
All 4 UX Designers are responsible for the user experience and visual design of the All 4 experience across mobile, smart TV’s and web. They are an integral part of the All 4 Product team to help define how our audience will interact with our service.

The cross-platform designer will be responsible for the UX across all of our platforms in collaboration with our platform specialists.

As part of a small team, this will work from one end of the product process to the other, taking ideas from inception to launch. This will typically involve a combination of working with research data & analysis, using service design approaches and techniques, creating core UX deliverables such as user flows, screen designs and prototypes for user testing and validation.

This is a mid-weight role reporting in to the All 4 UX Lead.

## Key Responsibilities
* Work with Product Management to develop and interrogate new product features
* Facilitate and contribute to service design workshops to understand and design for customer needs.
* Produce designs which include wireframes, user journeys, interface designs & prototypes
* Create technically feasible UX to reflect the established brand identity, UX, design & style standards
* Act as an advocate for good design standards, processes and the end user
* Present designs to teams
* Have an interest in design & UX and be able to discuss ideas, give and receive feedback.
* Understand design direction in order to communicate cross-functionally with Product & development teams
* When assigned to projects, provide progress updates against tasks during team & squad meetings
* Determine when a simple clickable prototype will suffice and when the research requires a more interactive prototype.
* Attend product/user testing and use feedback to further improve designs and design standards.

## Essential Experience & Skills
### Technical & Professional Skills
* Technical understanding of various digital platforms and how to leverage development frameworks in the creation of UX designs that make the most of development effort
* Experience in designing outputs for dynamic, high-traffic content-managed digital products
* Working knowledge of Sketch and other relevant digital design and prototyping software.
* Experience of working with front end developers
* Organised with excellent attention to detail
* Strong communications skills: with the ability to present ideas verbally
* Experience of the full delivery lifecycle for technology projects from requirements and design through technical delivery to implementation
* Understanding and experience of technical delivery processes and current project methodologies particularly agile

### Decision Making
Flexible and adaptable, able to function within a fast changing environment producing high quality output under pressure and to tight deadlines
Able to judge when things need to be escalated
Can work independently and make quick decisions with imperfect or incomplete data, while showing good judgment on when to escalate.
Able to multi-task across several concurrent projects and activities

### Relationship Management
A first-class collaborator, able to work closely with colleagues from any team or discipline and to flex their own role to suit a given situation.
Knows how to build strong relationships and looks for ‘win-win’ solutions
Comfortable working with external agencies and suppliers

### Strategic Perspective
Passionate about Channel 4 and its role in the digital marketplace.
Demonstrable awareness and personal interest in the digital landscape, industry developments, and in particular the impact of VOD on viewers and broadcasters.
Ability to see the All 4 product and its goals in the wider context of Channel 4’s strategic business and public service context.

## Job Description:
There has never been a more exciting time to join our digital and data team. Why? Because we are at the start of a journey that will fundamentally change our business, and how our customers shop with us both today – and in the future.

To help us reach our goal, we’re looking for super talented people who will help put digital and data at the heart of everything we do, so that we keep living and breathing it every day. In return, we offer fantastic learning opportunities, clear career pathways and the freedom to innovate, explore, be curious and think differently.

On the back of that, we are looking for a talented Senior UX Researcher to join our exciting and dynamic Digital Product team.

You’ll be responsible for working from problem definition stage, using the appropriate qual or quant research and discovery methods, through to evaluation of interfaces and interactions for digital products and services, at a global scale. The role feeds insights to formulate and prioritise delivery goals in a timely and iterative manner to support an agile cadence. The role stays abreast of trends and changes in the industry, to bring innovation and new thinking to this challenge.

The role is both strategic and hands-on. Through facilitation and effective communication skill, as part of a multi-discipline team, the Lead/Senior UX Researcher ensures a research-based human-centric approach is taken and is the voice and ambassador of the end-user - be it customer or colleague.

So, if you’d like to be part of a team that is already making a difference, and help us transform into a world class data driven organisation, we’d love to hear from you.

## Key accountabilities and measures
* Strong advocate of User Experience Research and shares the value of a human-centric approach across the business, with product teams through to senior management.
* Orchestrate and execute user research throughout the design and development cycle using appropriate qualitative and quantitative research techniques according to the stage of development
* Select the best research methods where required (formative and summative)
* Capture research requirements, plan kick off meetings, work within budget / timeline, devise approach to the research, draft research plans, write the discussion guides, conduct research sessions, analysis, synthesis, and reporting.
* Have a detailed understanding of our customer segments and personas - their behaviours, motivations, shopping habits, needs, demographics.
* Communicate and weave knowledge of our customers through projects by creating personas, customer journey maps and to help inform the business who our customers are and how they shop.
* Recruitment of customers through various channels (Panel, Social Media, Internal) and directly with recruitment agency
* Manage own time and workload in consultation with the UX Research Manager
* Maintain a repository of research insights for the business to access
* Analyse and synthesis findings into actionable insights for teams, considering the different teams’ need to see information pertinent to them, and communicate this clearly.
* Transfer key takeaways into impactful UX recommendations, user stories, personas, journey maps, UX design changes, user flows/needs and use case scenarios. Able to clearly articulate findings to teams across the business
* Facilitation of workshops to explain the outputs and insights from the research and their impact – providing design ideas and direction if needed
* Commissioning larger projects with 3rd party agencies, writing a brief (RFP), procurement of agencies, facilitating and managing the engagement. Ensuring relationships (stakeholders and the agency) are managed
* Confident collaborating with other Researchers, Product Designers, Product Managers, and technical teams as required to ensure objectives are clearly defined, understood etc., and advise on the appropriate research method(s)
* Show an appreciation for and understanding of UI design principles and use these to communicate research findings. Good to have - Wireframe ideas using tools such as Sketch or prototyping tools

## Key skills
* Degree in Psychology, UX Design, HCI, Human Factors, or Cognitive Science
* Proven knowledge of qualitative and quantitative research design and methodology
* Appreciation of data analytics and the principles of experiment design (A/B testing, MVT)
* Knowledge of UX design and familiar with common UX principles and guidelines
* Expert in designing, planning, conducting, analysing research studies across all product development stages
* Confident applying a range of research methodologies (online and in person) ethnography /contextual research/ depth interviews/ usability / focus groups / workshop facilitation / surveys / card Sorting /tree testing
* Engaging stakeholders to kick off research projects, assess requirements and advise appropriate research technique and why
* Designing research by creating clear objectives and hypothesis, writing discussion guides, and working with designers to ensure prototypes/test materials are useable.
* Work closely with recruitment agencies, define screeners and ensure participants represent target group. Use of Personas or customer profiling to support appropriate recruitment for the research objective.
* Knowledge of GDPR for UX Research activities
* Moderating the research, managing stakeholders/sessions, analysis and presentation of findings in engaging way
* Familiar with lab set up and management of lab and online technology for research (e.g., Lookback, UserTesting, UserZoom, Morae)
* Knowledge of accessibility and evaluation of user interface with for access needs
* Usability best practices and approaches
* Clear and effective communication and negotiation to ensure the customers voice is integrated into the web and mobile experience.
* Solid project management skills and record of accomplishment in delivery

## Job Description:
There has never been a more exciting time to join our Digital & Data team. Why? Because we on a journey that will fundamentally change our business and how our customers shop with us both today – and in the future.

Our digital products reach millions of customers each month who shop and engage with us. Partnering with commercial and technology teams, we solve challenging problems to innovate and create value for customers. If you thrive in ambiguity, enjoy being part of a problem-solving team, and are excited by changes that can improve experiences of colleagues and customers, join us!

We are looking for a talented Lead Product Designer to join our exciting and dynamic Digital Product team. If you want to be part of a team that is already making a difference, we’d love to hear from you.

## About the role
You will lead product design from initial research and discovery, (working with our small team of UX Researchers) through to final UI and visual design. Your contribution will be both strategic – supporting commercial goals, balancing feasibility with desirability; and hands-on, ensuring a human-centric approach guides the thinking and delivery throughout.

You will play a lead role in contributing to the overall product goal.


* User research about customer needs and behaviour to help develop design directions, and ensure we stay human-centric in our work.
* Plan, organise, and facilitate of workshops and collaborative design sessions to bring cross-functional teams together.
* Customer journey mapping for the journeys of M&S customers and contributing to service design thinking.
* Conceptualise, develop and document innovative information organisation structures, interaction designs, and navigation for digital products.
* Create stunning interfaces that support customer needs and bring the M&S brand to life.
* Work with the M&S brand and sub-brands to create a flowing experience between them.
* Prototype ideas for user research and communicating with colleagues.
* Use and contribute to our design system to ensure coherent and accessible experiences for our customers.

## About you
As a great collaborator, you find surprising new ways to work effectively with colleagues, wherever they are based. Your passion for human-centric design is infectious, and you infuse your approach to your work with this passion. Pragmatic, you can see how an idea will support commercial goals, as well as being feasible within the boundaries of technology. Your interest in people and customer’s lives motivate you to go out and do your own research – be that online or in-store.

Learning and personal growth keeps you up to date with design tools, industry trends, and your own effectiveness in communicating and influencing. You are generous with your knowledge, sharing insights and information to contribute to the shared knowledge of your design and research team members. You may already do some mentoring or line management for less-experienced designers, and you might be interested in doing more. Directing the work of other designers is something you’re comfortable with, and you enjoy creating the right environment for designers to flourish in.

Your resilience helps you bounce back from difficult situations, and you bring a positive outlook to knotty challenges, and tricky situations.

Player Research is the premier partner for games user research.

Hundreds of game development studios rely on our insights into usability, UX, appeal and play.

From our Brighton and Montreal studios we design and conduct award-winning UX research for video games: usability testing, expert reviews, engagement diaries, training courses… and so much more. Our clients are passionate developers seeking to understand their players to deliver affective and engaging gaming experiences.

We’re looking for experienced games user researchers to join our teams. You’ll find our broad range of clients, stakeholders and research questions to be invigorating. And you’ll find our work environment to be collegiate, adaptable, and inviting.

We’re seeking experienced games user researchers to join our studios in the UK and Canada

All our researchers are generalists. Their full-time job is the execution of varied user research studies that improve commercial video games. With increasing experience comes responsibilities for mentorship of peers, project ownership, research strategy consulting with clients, methodology design, and personal specialisation.

Our staff are a healthy mix of expert practitioners and academics, of ambitious career-starters and seasoned professionals. Experienced games user researchers—like you—bring unique perspectives and learnings to help us grow, and offer even richer insight to our client studios. In return, Player Research provides a stable and vibrant workplace to conduct the most fulfilling work of your career.

Who do we work with? Game developers, publishers, platform owners, incubators, universities… As an external research studio we collaborate far and wide. You’ll benefit from the long-term relationships we’ve forged with our key partners, while also having opportunities to develop fresh relationships with studios taking their first steps in player-centric development.

Around one third of our projects are commissioned by games user research teams inside studios or publishers

Our projects come in all shapes and sizes from usability testing to anti-toxicity research; game console UI to toys-to-life; AAA full-playthroughs to rapid expert evaluations for indies. Our consultant researchers are brought to the heart of design decision-making in projects of all types, be that spanning years of development or as one-off research engagements.

Although we collaborate with studios big and small, it’s noted that we choose not to contribute to real money gambling, nor adult entertainment games.

Every month we welcome new clients; each places their trust in Player Research to guide their creative and commercial vision

We are exceptionally proud of our decade-long reputation for authenticity, transparency and rigour. And we’d love to make you a part of it.

Whether you have one year or ten years of experience under your belt, we think you’ll find professional and personal fulfilment in joining our team.

## Core Responsibilities
As an experienced Games User Researcher you’ll work with a wide-range of studios to design and execute research. From one-off studies to development-spanning campaigns of research, you’ll deliver world-leading games user research as part of our team.

The day-to-day involves:
* Designing, scoping, managing and executing qualitative user research in collaboration with our wide array of partner studios
* Working alongside our Operations and Client Relations teams as a consultant. You’ll advise our partner studios on research approaches that will deliver them actionable and affordable insights
* Capitalising on every research project to share your knowledge with your peers, and try new things
* Applying your prior experience and unique research interests to diversify the insight we offer to our partner studios
* Capturing your knowledge in training materials, articles, talks, and mentoring your colleagues
* Applying yourself to the continuous improvement of yourself through training, writing, and evaluating video game UX
* Using your initiative to improve our processes for the benefit of colleagues and clients
* You’ll have two managers: a regional People Manager and a global Head of Research Craft, ensuring your professional and technical growth respectively

And depending on your research experience and personal goals, you should also be:
* Owning the development of new approaches and offerings
* Owning key client relations to be the trusted point-of-contact for advice and consultancy
* Speaking, writing and educating the world on the importance of games user research
* Compiling long-form research strategies to answer our partner studio’s strategic needs
* Writing and conducting training sessions, both internal-facing and client-facing

## Overview of the role and team structure
We’re looking for a Product Designer to join the Product Design team in our London Office. 

You’ll be working  alongside a **fully empowered squad** of engineers, researchers, product managers, with support from and access to relevant stakeholders from around the FT such as editorial, marketing, 

You’ll help deliver **end-to-end product experiences**, from exploratory research into opportunity definition, from ideation into concepting, from testing into shipping, measuring and iterating.

You’ll receive **regular guidance and support** from your squad, your line manager, our Director of Product design, and of course the whole Product Design team. We work hard to foster a safe environment where we share and discuss our work proactively, to inspire, support and guide each other.

We have a **transparent, measureable progression framework**, which outlines all of the skills FT Product Designers need, and details how to progress in each skill category. We use this as a basis for your biannual reviews, where you’ll self assess against the progression framework, track progression, and agree areas of focus with your line manager. 

We invest in our people to allow them to grow both personally and professionally whilst working at The FT. We offer a variety of ways in which you can progress your career with us, some of which are highlighted below: 
* **Career coaching** - Career coaching is time spent focused on you and how you can achieve your career aspirations. 
* **Mentoring programme** - The mentoring programme aims to connect people across the business to support professional and personal growth through knowledge sharing and guidance.
* **Learning and development** - The FT offers a host of learning and development opportunities that will not only help you build the skills you need to grow in your profession or field, but will also help you improve your own personal development, with courses such as self-coaching, productivity, presentation confidence, research techniques and much more.

## What you’ll be doing
Week to week, you’ll be:
* **Planning and prioritising. **You’ll have an equal stake in your squad’s direction. You’ll always be learning, planning and prioritising your areas of focus and approach together.
* **Researching and learning about users.** Defining and participating in user research and testing, together with Researchers. Digging into data with Analysts, to understand and measure behaviours. Working with editorial to understand content theory and process.
* **Analysing products. **Conducting competitor and comparator analysis. Reviewing existing journeys and features. you will explore ways of improving and innovating our experience.
* **Empathy and experience mapping.** Understanding user mindsets, motivations and expectations. Mapping experiences, journeys and flows, to help us unearth and prioritise pain points and opportunities.
* **Ideating. **Working with your squad to generate and prioritise ideas. Planning and facilitating co-creation sprints and workshops
* **Concepting and exploring.** Developing loose ideas into concepts. Working with your squad to evolve and prioritise those concepts.
* **Testing and learning fast.** Using a variety of testing approaches and techniques; card sorting, low and high fidelity prototypes, fake-door tests, multivariate testing, and shipping into the live environment to learn. 
* **Measuring and prioritising.** Measuring experiments with your squad. Abandoning unsuccessful concepts, and evolving successful ones.
* **Influencing the design system.** Designing new components, patterns, layouts, flows and interactions which will feed back into our design system and component library. 
* **Evolving! **We strive to continually improve and evolve. Evolving our process by adding new techniques and abandoning obsolete ones. Evolving our product until we achieve objectives, rather than stopping once we’ve shipped.

## What we’re looking for from you
* **We welcome applications from people who can demonstrate strong end-to-end product design competencies.** You’ll have shipped multiple features and iterations, perhaps across several products. You’ll probably have been a practicing product designer for 2+ years.
* **We’d like to see a portfolio** which helps us understand your Product Design approach and experience. Ideally the portfolio would tell us about the approach you took and what you learned, rather than only showcasing final designs. 
* Experience in digital events, communities and learning programmes. Customer journey analysis, on boarding, forms, identification of new opportunities within the community programme. 
* **A desire to learn, and hone your craft.** You’ll be surrounded by talented designers, product managers, researchers, engineers, etc. We cultivate an environment where everyone shares and learns from each other. It helps us all improve.

## Design at Elsevier 
The Elsevier design team is a cross-discipline group of over 70 designers in Asia, Europe, and the US working across a wide range of digital information products and tools. We sit amongst and work closely with product managers, developers, and QAs in a fast-paced Agile environment. We champion the best UCD and product development practices. Our work is firmly grounded in user research. 

We hope you can help us scale and improve our practices even further. 

## What’s in it for you 
* Help advance science, solve real-world problems, and work with inspirational users. 
* Work in a complex problem space to design effective tools that bring together academic authors, reviewers, and editors.
* Work on strategically important initiatives. 
* Be part of a supportive team with an innovative design culture. 
* Grow as a designer through coaching, training, and an established UX career development programme. 

## The role as a Lead UX Designer
At Elsevier, we are developing new tools to improve the experience of submitting scientific articles and getting them published. This is a top priority for our business, and you will be a key member of a team of twelve designers doing the research and design work to help us achieve our ambitious goals. 

You will be the lead designer for one of the product areas, working in close partnership with our product and technology leadership. You will also manage three other designers and lead initiatives to improve our overall design processes.

In a typical week, you will participate in agile ceremonies with your squad, plan or carry out discovery work on new concepts, create and deliver final designs for production, coach your direct reports, and work with other designers to deliver the best article-submission experience for our users.

## What you’ll be doing as a Lead UX Designer
* Lead design work on one of the products areas of publishing submissions, working closely with stakeholders to drive product strategy and prioritise design work.
* Run workshops, ideate and prototype quickly, produce detailed design deliverables, and work alongside product managers, developers and QAs to ship your designs into production. 
* Ensure that the product you design meets user needs, is aligned with wider product and business goals, and is in line with our front-end and back-end technologies. 
* Champion users throughout the design process. Develop a deep understanding of user needs through interviews and other research methods. Share insights with your team. Build empathy for users across the organisation. 
* Have line management responsibilities for three designers. Provide regular feedback, coaching, and performance appraisals as needed, and support them in their career development.
* Create concept designs for new products and take them from discovery to implementation. 
* Lead the work to make the article-submissions experience, which spans multiple products, more consistent and coherent.
* Collaborate with designers on different products across Elsevier to align experiences. 
* Build good working relationships with product and technology staff at all levels to ensure strategic alignment and effective working processes.
* Proactively improve how the Elsevier design team works by exploring new tools and design processes and sharing them with other designers.
* Assist with the recruitment and on-boarding of new designers as needed.

## What we’re looking for as a Lead UX Designer
* You have at least five years design experience and a broad design skillset with strong skills in user experience and user interface design. 
* You have a strong portfolio showing experience designing shipped products and services (not just websites) that meet user needs, product requirements, and business goals. 
* You have hands-on experience planning, conducting, and analysing user research and usability testing. 
* You have experience of working on design systems or developing a common design language to unify the user experience across products.
* You have great attention to detail and can produce high-fidelity designs and prototypes using tools such as Figma, Sketch, and Invision. 
* You know how design fits in an Agile environment and can work closely with product managers, developers, and QAs. 
* You are an excellent communicator who can present and explain the rationale behind designs to a wide range of stakeholders. 
* You are motivated, proactive, flexible, pragmatic, and good at time management and prioritisation. You want to make things better. You find solutions to problems. You understand how to produce real-world designs given time and technical constraints. 
* (Nice to have) Line management experience
* (Nice to have) Experience working in-house in a large organisation. 
* (Nice to have) Experience working with academics or researchers. 

## About Elsevier 
Elsevier is a world-leading provider of scientific, technical, and medical knowledge. Our mission is to help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. 

Using innovative technology, we deliver information and analytics through tools that help our users make breakthroughs. We publish 18% of the world’s scientific articles. Over 18 million monthly users visit ScienceDirect, the world’s largest database dedicated to peer-reviewed primary scientific and medical research. Over 2 million monthly users use the Mendeley Reference Manager app to organise and read academic research.

Over two years you will work at two of the businesses within the LexisNexis Risk Solutions Group, Cirium focuses on aviation and travel data whilst the LexisNexis Risk Solutions role will be in Financial Crime Screening.  In both roles you will work to build out your experience of a user-centred design process learning best practice methods for researching, designing and validating solutions within a team of UX designers.

As a company that provides business to business data solutions we look at solving complex workflow problems for our customers and delivering insights from vast quantities of data that help customers to make critical decisions. In Financial Crime Screening we help financial institutions prevent money laundering, terrorist funding and fraud. At Cirium we help airports plan where to park the planes, airlines to plan maintenance of their fleet and insurers to estimate the risk level by knowing the wear of every component of an aircraft. 

We have a very active UX community across the group which works collectively to share best practice and keep each other up to date on UX tools and techniques. You will have the opportunity to learn from and contribute to this community as you develop your skills. 

A typical day would involve meeting with product managers to review designs for new product features, time spent designing user interfaces and working with developers to bring designs to reality. At times you will be able to interview end users and watch them using our products while asking questions to understand their needs and pain points. You may find yourself selling the value of UX to teams that haven’t had much exposure to the benefits yet or gathering with a group of UX colleagues to brainstorm a new solution.  

There will also be focused learning through the graduate scheme specifically for UX and general corporate skills training along with the full graduate cohort. You will be expected to drive most of your own learning with online resources and by reaching out to people in the community.  

This role requires creativity, a strong logical mind, a good design eye and the ability to see things from someone else’s point of view.  You will learn to tell a good story to communicate the user needs to your team and sell your design solution to them.  

## Opportunities and Responsibilities
Gradually, with support, you will be able to
* Identify the goals, user journeys and information architecture for web/software/mobile app interfaces to meet the needs of our user personas
* Collaborate with the design team on a design system and/or developing consistent best practice guidelines
* Collaborate with the wider RSG community of talent, learning from outside sources of expertise beyond your business
* Work independently on projects with the support of senior designers
* Be a leading voice for design and best practice, raising situations with senior designers for support and consultation if necessary
* Create low-fidelity sketches to demonstrate how users could interact with products. 
* Create detailed wireframes and interactive prototypes to evolve product design
* Run user research and usability testing to validate designs and update designs based on customer feedback

## Key Skills
* A recent Bachelor’s degree or higher qualification in a related discipline is desirable e.g. HCI, user experience, product design, graphic design, interaction design, usability. Candidates from other backgrounds are encouraged if you can demonstrate that you have design skills and interest in UX
* Empathy for users and passion for helping to create new digital products
* Excellent communication and team work skills
* Time management skills, being adaptable to the requirements of multiple projects
* Proactive in representing yourself and building relationships with teams outside of the UX community
* An appreciation of UX design methodologies and trends
* Ability to learn quickly and work in a fast-paced environment
* Familiarity with design software such as Sketch, Axure, AdobeXD, InVision DSM or similar
* A portfolio showing examples of your work (can be coursework, work experience or personal blog)

## Job Introduction
**Please note that this advert is not for any Midweight UX role in particular. We have a number of opportunities at this level in our User Experience & Design team - if your application is successful, we’ll be in touch with the roles that best suit your experience and development goals.**

We’re looking for someone who can bring imagination and curiosity to help the BBC solve some of the its biggest challenges to date. You like collaborating with people from a variety of disciplines and using your skills to help make great ideas come to fruition. You’ve probably worked alongside researchers and business analysts to discover requirements in complex environments, and are happy and capable running multiple projects at once.

To learn more about UX&D at the BBC follow this link to our website called GEL (Global Experience Language) and check out some of our videos with the teams:

[https://www.bbc.co.uk/gel/articles/about-bbc-uxd](https://www.bbc.co.uk/gel/articles/about-bbc-uxd)

## Main Responsibilities
**In a typical day, you can expect to:**

* Share design expertise and ideas with people from design, product, editorial and tech teams
* Collaborate with other members of User Experience & Design to get to the heart of what our users need, creating sketches, concepts, user journeys, wireframes and navigational prototypes
* Research and design for multiple platforms and touch points
* Work with people across UX&D to make sure we’re making the most of the BBC’s Global Experience Language
* Involve audience members and end-users throughout the product/service lifecycle to make sure they’re meeting real user needs
* Plan and prioritise your own workload
* Work with external agencies to learn new things, see new perspectives and create new ideas.
* Do all this with a view to achieving a single, seamless service on all screens across all BBC products

## Are you the right candidate?
Your portfolio is full of consistently strong work across different screens and experiences - be they on mobile, connected TV, tablet, desktop of connected device. You’re fascinated by people and what motivates them, and you relish the challenge of bringing your skills to helping solve their problems and craft delightful designs for them. You understand the value of collaborating in cross-discipline teams, and you can switch into a facilitation role to get teams energised.

 

You might have strengths in interaction design, colour, branding or typography.  You might have skills in language for interfaces, augmented reality and information architecture. Or maybe you've got something special up your sleeve like you're a top illustrator, motion graphic designer or prototype builder. Our team's made up of a diverse range of people, skills, and experience, so we'd love to hear about you and yours.

## About Pearson

We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people. We’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. Pearson is regularly featured on the Forbes list of Best Employers and we are recognised in the Best Employers for Diversity 2019 awards. Pearson is listed on both the London and New York stock exchanges (UK: PSON; NYSE: PSO).

## About the Role
The User Experience Design team is a dedicated, professional, fun and supportive group of people, who work creatively to deliver outstanding products and services for the UK Schools market.

### Key activities
UX designers within our team are responsible for bringing the user’s voice to product development efforts and have a deep understanding of user needs, goals and motivations. They design digital experiences which solve problems and delight users, whilst factoring in business requirements and technical limitations. Depending on specific project needs, this may involve researching, ideating, sketching, prototyping and/or user-testing.

UX designers are expected to have a solid grounding and understanding of all aspects of UX design. With some support they should be able to collaborate with stakeholders and prioritise tasks and their necessary fidelity. They may deepen their skills and begin to specialise in one or more areas as they develop within the role. This provides opportunity to share expertise with others and work on projects with a specific need and focus.

Our team works in a collaborative way with product, content, technology, broader design team colleagues and marketing to bring ideas to life. We apply best practice from a diverse range of disciplines such as interaction design, cognitive science, visual design and instructional design. Pearson is an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants and select the best person for each job based on relevant skills and experience.We are also committed to building an accurate picture of the make-up of the workforce and encouraging equality and diversity.The information you provide will stay confidential, and be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process.

### Qualifications
We are looking for someone with the following skills and qualities:

* User research skills, including developing personas, user stories, flow diagrams and IA artefacts
* UX/interaction design skills including sketching, wireframing and rapid prototyping
* Experience planning and conducting user testing, including choosing the most appropriate methodology to achieve goals and creating persuasive reports outlining recommendations
* Confident facilitating or supporting workshops to create a shared understanding amongst team and stakeholders
* Willingness to refine ideas through iteration, testing and design reviews
* Knowledge of best practice accessibility guidelines and experience applying to designs, particularly in terms of the content, structure, interactions and navigation
* Experience working within an agile delivery process and resolving challenges during implementation
* Strong communication and collaboration skills; stakeholder engagement, team-working and relationship building
* Flexibility and adaptability to change

### Role location
This is currently a remote working position until Summer 2021. Thereafter, the individual assigned can work flexibly as a remote worker between their home and can attend an office location if dependant on business requirement.

## What you will get from working for us
We are keen to offer learning and development to help you progress your career to the next level. Working for Pearson will open up a wide range of career progression routes, including into qualification development, assessment, operations, technology, procurement and more. You will also have an opportunity to lead on initiatives that input into Pearson’s digital transformation strategy. As a global education business with an outstanding reputation, a role within Pearson will provide you with the skills to progress your career to the next level and beyond.

## Application details
To apply to the role, please submit an updated CV, cover letter and portfolio of your work. We will be reviewing applications and scheduling interviews regularly, so we encourage applications to be submitted as soon as possible.

## About the Team
The Creative team is comprised of product and brand designers who collaborate to solve important problems for publishers. The product designers focus mainly on designing the Sovrn platform, while the brand designers work on marketing efforts including the Sovrn website, promotional materials, infographics, and anything it takes to communicate the Sovrn mission to customers.

## About the Job
As a Product Designer II, you’ll work with an international team on the design and front-end development of best-in-class SaaS business applications. You’ll focus on UI/UX design, and on what constitutes a great user experience—then you’ll work with teams across Sovrn to research, build, and execute products that influence the entire publishing industry. You’ll be heavily involved in user research and user testing, so it’s essential that you’re able to effectively collaborate with others, as well as communicate clearly with team members of diverse backgrounds.

## What You’ll Be Doing
* Drive the vision, strategy, design and execution of the core framework products that serve as the foundation for Sovrn’s publisher platform
* Product design in Figma — collaborating with product and creative team members, keeping organized files, presenting iterative work to colleagues and test users
* Product discovery alongside design and engineering teams to design and test prototypes
* Use rapid prototyping and user testing techniques to minimize the risk of investment
* Establish a feedback loop with internal and external stakeholders and use feedback to guide product prioritization 
* Participate in agile ceremonies to ensure the engineering team delivers products that meet or exceed expectations
* Research market conditions and industry leadership to ensure that product strategy both predicts and takes advantage of emerging trends
* Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to position and message new products for go-to-market efforts

## About You
As with anyone on the creative team, the role will have a high energy, can-do attitude, and a passion for design. The right candidate must thrive in high-stress environments where deadlines are the norm. This person naturally is incredibly organized, dependable, detail-oriented and able to work under tight deadlines. Additionally, this designer must possess an excellent work ethic, undeniable talent, and a good sense of humor. Above all, you love taking a product from concept to launch, and you’re proficient in every step of the design process: from researching, sketching, and wireframing, through to user testing, refinement, prototyping, and development.

## The successful candidate will have
* Fluency in: Figma, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InVision
* Keen understanding of and passion for human-centered design
* The ability to talk about your design solutions and confidence to stand behind your convictions
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience working with multidisciplinary teams
* Experience analyzing data and turning insights into action
* 3+ years of product design experience
* A Bachelor’s degree in a technically relevant field preferred, or relevant work experience

## Bonus Points
* A background in UI/UX design
* A background in consumer-facing analytics products
* Demonstrable passion for great design
* Familiarity with the React framework and Google Material Guidelines

Position Reports to: Creative Director

We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of accountability impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We expect you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we're looking for.

## About Sovrn
Publishers create the content the world depends on for education, entertainment, and commerce. ## Background
It is an extremely exciting time here at HM Courts and Tribunals Service! We are currently undertaking a first-of-its-kind Change Programme aimed at delivering pioneering judicial services that better serve the public, and with over £1 Billion of funding this is the most ambitious programme of its kind anywhere in the world.
As part of the Strategy and Change Directorate you will be at the forefront of creating and implementing change in our world-leading justice system. The Programme is ambitious, and we need resilient, resourceful and adaptable people to make it happen.

### User Experience and Insight Team - User Research Division
We are redesigning and rebuilding our courts and tribunal services around the needs of our users. These reforms cover: the physical location and environment of courts, telephony-based services and a full range of digital services including establishing new virtual case hearings.
The User Research team’s current focus is producing, through primary research, actionable insights that inform – and then validate – the organisation’s user experience design. The team also helps maintain fundamental design principles of being user led and adopts agile ways of working and continuous improvement in the delivery of transformed HMCTS services and products.
The team is made up of user researchers with a passion for driving the design and development of user experiences that fulfil HMCTS’s goal of being user-focused and evidence driven. Your research will touch on the lives of every type of citizen as well as a range of other users such as legal professionals and judges.

## Key Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for developing and overseeing the effective use of user research to inform the delivery of the Strategy and Change Directorate.
* Understand and communicate why user-centred design is important and how user research contributes to it
* Know which techniques are appropriate to generate specific kinds of insights into user behaviour and needs, so that research activities are focused on delivering value to the end user
* Create data-driven user personas and use them as a tool to support user-centred design decision making
* Plan out research activities including the schedule of activities, methods, and allocation of resources required
* Facilitate 1-to-1 sessions and/or focus groups, guide discussions and build rapport
* Source and procure participants and facilities to conduct user research activities, specifying requirements for user testing groups
* Communicating user research findings in powerful and persuasive ways
* Conduct user journey mapping exercises and use them as a tool to support user-centred design decision making
* Work closely with design teams to incorporate user research findings into the design; so that it maintains focus on user needs
* Use evidence drawn from data and research analysis to represent the user in product and design discussions
* Monitor performance and report against plans and taking effective corrective action if required
* Ensuring that quality control tools and techniques are applied effectively
* Manage effective engagement with all relevant stakeholders to make sure that, where appropriate, their needs are incorporated

### Other duties
The post holder is required to work in a flexible way and undertake any other duties reasonably requested by line management which are commensurate with the grade and level of responsibility of this post.

## Essential Skills & Experience:
* At least 1 year of experience conducting public-facing user research
* Strong research and analytical skills and the ability to communicate the outcomes clearly
* Strong understanding of user-centred design principles and tools
* Experience of using the appropriate research methods to generate specific insights into user behaviour and needs
* Experience of facilitating and communicating with stakeholders, for example senior management teams and the public
* Experience of working with suppliers to deliver outcomes to the required quality

## Desirable Skills & Experience:
* 3+ years conducting user experience research - demonstrated expertise in a relevant field
* Experience of defining or delivering services for the Digitally Excluded;
* Degree in Psychology, Sociology, Anthropology, Human Geography or related field
* Understanding of human-computer interaction and human factors
* Experience of working on a large project or programme;
* Experience managing, executing and analysing usability test sessions or focus group sessions
* Experience of working in an agile development environment with User Experience teams, designers and developers to create new digital products and services
* Experience of introducing new ways of working into an existing team or department;
* Experience of working with the courts and tribunals service, in the legal community or justice sector

## About Cera
Cera’s mission is to empower people to live their best lives, in their own home, through the use of technology, professional care and support. We are changing the way people receive care by empowering our professional carers with insight and improved decision making. Armed with technology, we are diving deeper into the world of traditional care, showing a lost generation that things can be done better. We believe technology can enable carers to do what they do best, care. Cera has grown at an unprecedented rate since its launch in November 2016, now providing over 30,000 care visits a day with over 6,000 staff nationwide.

## About the role 
UX Designers play a pivotal role in creating Cera’s solutions for our carers and customers. A key focus of this role is to ensure that Cera’s product experiences are the best that they possibly can be, so that Cera can achieve its goal of providing great care to all of our customers while improving the experience of everyone involved in care delivery. You will work remotely with our engineering teams (on and off shore) and product teams as well as getting close to the operational staff and carers who use our products every day. This role requires building a deep knowledge of our processes and a passion for user centred design and its application to our technology. Your work will have a huge impact on the way that care is experienced. 

## Role and responsibilities
* Work with our UX Research team to collect and analyse feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape UX design requirements, features and products
* Work with qualitative and quantitative data and carry out behaviour analysis to identify opportunities to improve and optimise our experiences 
* Understand our strategy and vision and the impact that experience design can bring to our products 
* High quality and timely delivery of UX artefacts through every stage of the product and user centred design lifecycle including 
  * Sketches 
  * Wireframes 
  * Low and high fidelity prototypes 
  * Final development-ready designs 
* Take the lead on design thinking, ideation sessions and collaborative workshops
* Work with our Product teams to ensure our products are easy to use and appropriate for the end user 
* Keeping close to the market, conducting competitor analysis and ensuring we’re constantly innovating our experiences and products 
* Work with senior management to drive experience innovation in our products. 
* Make creative recommendations to expand the product base and vision 

## What we’re looking for
You’ll play a key part in helping establish new ways of embedding UX Design within Cera. You’ll have the ability to juggle multiple projects and will understand how to prioritise your work and time based on an understanding of the impact of your deliverables to your stakeholders and projects. 
* You thrive in mission-driven organisations, working with collaborative teams who are passionate about utilising technology and building products to better the world around us. 
* You have some solid experience working in a UX Designer role and champion best UX practice. 
* You have the ability to stay laser focused on our end users, conducting internal and external research and competitor analysis to ensure our engineering and teams are building useful and delightful solutions to deliver our mission. 
* Proven application of User Centred design principles and processes is highly desirable
* Experience of innovation in digital product experiences (i.e, mobile, web, data) 
* Experience working with engineers and product owners through ideation, development and optimisation of products and features
*  A keen interest in product lifecycle management 
* Familiarity with Agile frameworks
* A pragmatic approach to prioritising your own work and working with senior management
* Experience of challenging stakeholders to ensure a relentless focus on our customers and the experiences we provide them

## Benefits
* Great career development opportunity with a fast-growing company with ambition
* Mobile phone, laptop and all the technology you’ll need
* Flexible remote working 
* Competitive salary, discretionary bonus & long term employee incentive plan 
* 25 days paid annual leave + your birthday off + UK bank holidays 
* Recognition awards 
* Group pension scheme 
* Lifeworks discount platform & Employee Assistance Programme 
* Refer a friend scheme 

## Life at Cera
We’re committed to creating an inclusive workforce. We believe in a world where you have the freedom to explore and express yourself without judgement, no matter who you are or where you’re from. Where you value yourself and feel proud of who you are. Where individuality is a source of confidence, because difference makes the world a better place.

## What’s it like to be part of the Cera team?
Our team is made up of academics, innovators, start-up accelerators and care experts, all connected by a vision to build a better future for care through the combination of best-in-class carers, empowered by technology.

You have the opportunity to join a purpose-driven company at the tipping point of transformation. You’ll play a key part in the evolution of Cera and make a real impact, now and in the future.

## About Grafana Labs
There are more than 700,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a SpaceX launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include two other open-source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs) and Grafana Tempo (for traces)

**This is a remote role and we are considering candidates located in the European timezones.**

## UX Team at Grafana Labs
The UX Team at Grafana Labs is led by [Diana](https://twitter.com/sarlinska) and [David](https://twitter.com/davkals) and has a plan to grow from seven to twelve designers over the course of this year. As a Product Designer in the Grafana section of the UX Team, you will be working closely with the engineering teams focusing on Open Source part of our story (especially Dominik, Ivana, and Torkel – founder of the project), our first product managers that we're also hiring, and other UX designers (especially Nico, Oana, and Jess). Also, you will be frequently interacting with the Grafana open source community and our paying customers.

Grafana has over 5.3M users, so improving the product and different parts of its experience will have a massive impact. A lot of other systems integrate with Grafana and there are many points where this can be a challenging experience, especially for new users. 

Our backlog is full of work waiting for you. You will be able to mix more strategic and high level work with creating detailed designs. You may be working on a **new onboarding experience**, try to solve **complex navigation issues**, research and design our **new Alerting feature**, help with **accessibility efforts** across the whole product or research and design solutions for **how Grafana can be used for IoT**. You can count on fast feedback cycles: We run company-wide feedback sessions weekly, and our software is continuously being released – your ideas will be put into users’ hands very quickly.

## Who we are looking for
* You are **comfortable working in a remote-first company**; communication is key. For us, working together means being collaborative, friendly, kind and respectful. We operate by consensus, you can contribute to a discussion but then commit to the team decision.
* You have at least a **couple of years of experienceas a UX or UI designer**. We are a relatively small Design Team working remotely on a product used by over 5 million users – the ability to work on your own and ship designs is crucial. 
* You have a good understanding of a **holistic UX process** and have a strong **user-centered approach** when making design decisions. You easily build an understanding of users’ context, goals, and motivations.
* You **enjoy talking to users** to gather and evaluate requirements and ideas. At the same time, you know how to recognize ideas and solutions that bring the biggest value to them and have the biggest impact on their experience. 
* You know how to transform insights into ideas – you are able to **prototype and validate them by yourself**, through further research or** usability testing**. You are able to communicate those ideas clearly and are solid in written and spoken English.
* You have a good understanding of accessibility in web solutions and have experience **designing solutions that follow accessibility standards**.
* You enjoy working on **complex solutions** – Grafana is a highly technological solution and has avid followers who rely on it every day and care deeply about their workflows.
* We'd ask you to provide a portfolio that not only shows nice pictures, but also mentions your actual process and concrete contribution to the respective projects.

## Benefits
At our core Grafana Labs is an open company. We believe that open source is the superior way to build and deliver software. We also believe in being open and transparent with our employees. We believe that transparency breeds trust and that trust is the foundation of great teamwork. We actively seek to break down silos, empower employees with information and allow people to “see the whole picture”. This transparency extends to our strategy, our financials, our successes and failures. We empower our team to make their own decisions and trust that they will try to do the right thing.

We are a remote first team. Our three founders are on three different continents and our team of 200+ global employees is based in 36 different countries. Hiring remotely unlocks the broadest, most diverse, most talented pool of potential employees. It also means that we have built our culture around a flexible and autonomous work environment based on trust.
Working at Grafana Labs can unlock the next step in your career as you will be able to both attend and speak at conferences. Some of our staff also teach at university and startup accelerators.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**- At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

## Job Introduction
**Please note that this advert is posted for several Senior User Experience & Design opportunities across D+E. So, if your application is shortlisted and we interview you, we can best recommend the product or area that you'll initially join**

If you’ve ever seen or heard some BBC content on a digital device, we almost certainly designed it – be it breaking news, football scores, the latest drama on iPlayer, or asking Alexa to play Radio 6music. We also design the ‘behind the scenes’ employee experiences to help make these happen. Our ace team of UX designers, architects, writers and researchers collaborate closely with product, editorial and technical teams right across the BBC to do this. 

To learn more about UX&D at the BBC follow this link to our website called GEL (Global Experience Language) and check out some of our videos with the teams:

[https://www.bbc.co.uk/gel/articles/about-bbc-uxd](https://www.bbc.co.uk/gel/articles/about-bbc-uxd)

## Main Responsibilities
* Be the voice of the user in project teams, explaining your rationale to developers, editorial staff and product managers
* Collaborate with other members of User Experience & Design to get to the heart of what our users need: creating sketches, concepts, user journeys, wireframes, and navigational prototypes
* Engage the wider team and key stakeholders in the user-centred design process, ensuring that user research is at the heart of design decision making
* Input into recruitment and development of mid-weight and junior staff, including regular catch-ups, professional development, input into appraisals, and manage poor performance where required
* Work with people across UX&D to make sure we’re making the most of the BBC’s Global Experience Language (GEL)
* Instigate projects, prioritise your own workload, and plan the work of other UX colleagues in your team
* Guide the work of external agencies and freelancers to learn new things, see new perspectives and collaborate on new ideas
* Help organise formal user research and proactively try out ideas and designs with people on the street to make sure we’re meeting real user needs
* Support a positive working environment that considers the needs of a diverse team

## Are you the right candidate?
Our Senior UX roles encompass the fields of Designer, Information Architect, Writer, and Design Researcher. For this particular position, we’re looking for strong skills in interaction design, visual design, creative facilitation, branding and typography.

Service design is a growth area, and we welcome those with the skills and curiosity to understand the why, what and how of people and make sure that’s communicated effectively. Or maybe you've got something special up your sleeve, like top skills in illustration, motion graphic design or prototype building. Our team's made up of a diverse range of people, skills, and experience, so we'd love to hear about you and yours. 

Your portfolio is full of consistently great work across different screens and experiences – be they on mobile, connected TV, tablet, desktop or connected device. Now you're ready to take all that experience and expertise and use it to inspire others. Yes, you can craft delightful designs. But you know improving user experiences isn't just about grafting away at the drawing board. You take a broader view – approaching design conceptually and thinking about the whole experience across multiple screens and touchpoint.

Whether you learned your skills on a design degree or on the job, you're comfortable using them to explain design concepts to anyone, no matter how senior or inexperienced. And you know how to balance what the user needs with what's really achievable. You're enthusiastic, curious and full of ideas. You keep up to speed with the latest design trends and technology developments. And you’re constantly fascinated by what people really need, and how we can create the right experience for them.C

Our new operating model represents a strong shift to regional delivery supported by expert corporate teams. Local health systems are supported by our integrated regional teams who play a major leadership role in the geographies they manage.

We are looking for a UI designer to take charge of maintaining quality and consistency across a portfolio of on-line data visualisation tools.  The NHS has one of the most respected brands, and of course it also has a need for extreme clarity in all its visual materials. We need someone in our team who can take up the challenge of maintaining standards in a group of already mature products and lead the UI development of new ones.

The ideal candidate will be someone who:
* has 3+ years' design experience working primarily in UI design.
* has degree-level qualification in Graphic Design or related subject.
* has designed data driven B2B tools.
* understands how to design assets within the constraints of a mature brand.
* has experience of creating style guides and component libraries.
* enjoys the hustle and bustle of the agile development environment.
* gets creative satisfaction by designing interfaces that are extremely easy to use.
* has enough technical insight to speak the developers' language.
* is a passionate advocate of inclusive design.
* likes to get involved in whatever else is happening in the creative team: UX design, user testing, design training for colleagues etc.
* is sociable and enjoys working with other people from all disciplines.
* is excited by the chance to contribute to the efficient running of the NHS.

The salary will start at £45,753. You will initially be working remotely, then spend more and more time in the central London offices, as circumstances allow. Alternatively, fully remote working is feasible, but visits to the London offices will be required up to twice monthly.

## Introduction 
This is an exciting time to work in the Department for International Trade (DIT), a department at the heart of the UK’s relationship with the global economy.  

Our role is to promote and enable UK trade globally by supporting businesses to take advantage of the appetite for British goods and services around the world, attracting foreign companies and investment to our shores, and helping international companies collaborate with UK suppliers.  

Over the next 3 years, DIT aims to deliver a step-change in UK trade and investment. Digital services, data and technology are central to the department’s ability to meet its objectives.  

## About the Digital, Data and Technology (DDaT) team  
Our DDaT team comprises about 200 people across a whole range of DDaT specialisms, working in agile, multi-disciplinary teams. Our public-facing services are visited millions of times each year and the tools we develop for our staff, across the globe, are an essential part of their daily working lives.  

We believe in creativity, curiosity, diversity of thought, entrepreneurship, delivery focus and collaboration. We embody the DIT values to be expert, enterprising, engaged and inclusive. These values have helped us become a high performing team that continuously delivers high-quality outputs. We’re Kingfisher. You might know us as B&Q, Screwfix, Castorama, Brico Depot or Koçtaş. We’re made up of over 79,000 passionate people, call over 1,300 stores home and operate in 8 countries. ## Responsibilities
As a Kingfisher Product Designer, you will use your creative skills in the delivery of design solutions for a number of digital products and features, for a number of household name brands. With an interesting remit, there is the opportunity to work on delivering industry leading features for complex journeys on a number of established digital products, from conception through to feature and component delivery.

 You will be a part of a multi-disciplined team that deliver innovative and high crafted experiences to our customers; working collaboratively with other Product Designers, Service & Interaction Designers, Design Researchers, Solutions Architects, Visual Designers and Developers.  Day to day you’ll be working with Design Leads and your team to create, test and refine ideas. You’ll be producing light-weight deliverables in a fast paced environment, with a focus on Lean delivery, in order to learn and iterate.

We are looking for someone that

## Job description
We work with ambitious technology brands that are looking to achieve accelerated success. We live and breath technology.

RCCO builds the key creative elements tech brand need to land clients, communicate their USPs and scale-up. We are digital focussed creatives building unique and engaging experiences, so that brands can transform the future.

## About you
Our perfect candidate is someone hungry to learn and be involved in understanding our clients' creative needs. You are a team player who's passionate and driven to work on not just one, but a variety of great global brands.

Your key day-to-day roles will be:

* **Leading digital projects** - working across websites, product UX, and apps. Taking projects from the briefing stage through to MVP launch and ongoing development. Guiding clients on best practises, helping them transform their online experiences with thoughtful user experience and bold design. Leading other members of the digital team with clear feedback, growing their knowledge with your experience.
* **UX Design** - diagnose and understand the needs of our client’s user base. Create clear stories and solve user needs with UX solutions for our digital projects. Build wireframes that test user flows and allow our team to further develop the strategy before design. Use best practises, to work with clients to structure their content and navigation in a meaningful way and help simplify the experience for users.
* **UI Design** - create organised and thoughtful designs for our engineering team to build. Extend our client’s branding through design for online environments. Create UI component libraries that scale design systems and enable consistency. Transform UX wireframes into exciting online experiences, that consider all device sizes. Build for user interaction beyond static design, including using motion.

An ideal candidate will have experience working at a creative agency, as part of an in-house creative team or as a freelancer on digital design projects. You will be working across multiple projects, whether it be websites, platform UI or sales and marketing material. You will need to show a passion for design, ability to push boundaries and build creative solutions to complex problems.

Your role will be mainly working on our top-tier client projects. You will critique your own work and the work of others on your team. This is to ensure the best quality and consistency across projects, and verifying it meets our design standards and QA checks. As a digital designer, you will help coach the designers on your team and help grow both the quality of work and client satisfaction. You will interact with the brand, engineering and account management team, helping them solve briefs with creative solutions.

The work is extremely varied – so the ability to tackle different types of jobs with equal amounts of enthusiasm and skill is essential. Above everything else, you will have a positive ‘can-do’ attitude. You will have consideration for UX and usability across the multiple channels of your work. It is essential that you can take a brief and add value to the client’s goals. Your main day-to-day work will be on Whimsical, Figma and Google Workspace. Any experience with motion design, prototyping, and/or illustration of vector assets is a bonus.

A large majority of client work will be for the advertising and technology industries, including working with one of the world’s largest brands - Google. You will become a core part of a small and agile team where your opinion counts in helping to grow the brand and business.

## Job requirements

### Required
* 3+ years industry experience working in a creative agency, in-house creative team or as a freelancer
* Experience leading UX/UI design for digital products and websites 
* Able to grow the members of the creative team using your expertise and skills
* Extensive knowledge of UX/UI principles, ability to create UI design systems and build for a digital environment, preparing files for Engineering handover 
* Digital design expert with excellent visual, written and verbal communications skills
* Experience using Figma, Framer or Sketch (we use Figma and Whimsical)
* Able to take design feedback and incorporate it quickly, solving user and client problems
* Able to balance time across multiple projects, working in a fast-growth environment
* Work with minimal supervision, taking responsibility for your work and being able to prioritise projects in an organised manner, managing expectations across teams
* Demonstrate initiative in responding to briefs, bringing ideas to life with an enthusiastic and proactive approach, guiding client projects with your experience
* Able to work in our office in East London (Stratford, E20) once it is safe to do so again. This role only for people legally eligible to work in the UK

### Preferred/Bonus Skills
* Experience in the advertising or technology industry
* Experience with motion design, animation and/or Principle prototypes
* Experience working with vector graphics / assets

**Salary: Competitive based on experience**

## Perks
Perks include Macbook Pro, team away days, social Thursdays, flexible working and exclusive client perks.

Location: Remote until safe to return to office. Our office is Plexal, Stratford - [Watch the video](https://youtu.be/2155hr1D2Sk) - Unlimited tea, coffee, flexible break-out working areas, ping pong, yoga classes, canal-side views, and much more!

## Description
Alexa Shopping is at the intersection of AI and retail experience. Our team is building a product that millions of customers love to use, so convenient and compelling customers will rely on Alexa at every stage of the shopping experience — from expert product guidance to listing to ordering to post-purchase support — across devices, Amazon desktop and mobile, in all countries where Alexa is available.

Alexa Shopping seeks a Designer to define and drive the future of shopping at Amazon. In this role, you will work with voice and graphic interface in a fast-paced environment. From inception through launch, you will be a design owner, responsible for delivering ambitious concepts, and using data to iterate and improve, translating needs and constraints into simple, intuitive, customer-focused solutions. You will define concept and execution, articulating end-to-end experience, and drive that vision into solid design deliverables such as user interface designs for voice and screen, interaction models, design specs, and prototypes. You will collaborate closely with engineering, product management and marketing both inside our organization, and with partner teams.

The ideal candidate will have experience with early-stage product development, and be passionate, focused, and relentless. If you have drive to innovate across modes of UI and existing and emerging devices, join us in developing the next generation of Alexa experience.

## Responsibilities

* Communicate and specify design concepts, solutions, and needs to senior executives

* Contribute to the group’s best practices for UX design while continually advocating design thinking, process, and craft throughout our organization
* Partner with development teams to build experiences and review finished interfaces (voice and screen) throughout the development lifecycle, maintaining a high bar for design and execution
* Use positive energy to maintain personal and team momentum

## Basic Qualifications
* Portfolio of shipped work demonstrating UX design leadership and understanding of user-centered design principles
* Demonstrated experience designing throughout the entire product development lifecycle
* Minimum 7+ years of experience as an UX/Interaction Designer or a similar role.
* A bachelor's degree in design, interaction or a related UX degree, or commensurate industry experience
* Expertise with standard design and prototyping tools like Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite

## Preferred Qualifications
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
* Demonstrated ability to successfully deliver projects of significant scope and high complexity
* Experience planning and conducting user research
* Experience designing multimodal product experiences including voice UI
* Experience in communication design and information architecture
* Experience defining and driving creative solutions in new/ambiguous product territory

This role sits within the Digital and Data Services Directorate (DDS) as part of the User Research & Design Team. The role is for an experienced practitioner who is able to plan and lead user research activities in larger teams on complex services and influence project operational and strategy delivery. This person is required to have the ability to build strong working relationships with stakeholders at all levels to explain and demonstrate the evidence of the user's needs.

This person will have experience in identifying and developing the user community to support on-going user research and assessing sample size necessary for robust evidence based research. The individual will require experience in using a variety of user research methodologies to reveal actionable customer insights and will have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. They will also be comfortable working with data, gathering and analysing it and the ability to quickly develop recommendations based on quantitative and qualitative evidence.

This individual will be expected to build user-centred practices across the organisation, to have experience in working with agile teams, aligning user research activities with wider plans to inform a service proposition and supervise / develop other user researchers to assure and improve research practices.

## Key Accountabilities

## Who we are
At the Government Digital Service (GDS), our mission is to build a simple, joined-up and personalised experience of government for everyone.
