## What you'll do
GDS is hiring user researchers to support our exciting and ambitious strategy. We are looking for several user researchers to join us across the board, in the GOV.UK, Digital Identity and Government as a Platform (GaaP) teams.

User Researchers are key figures in the teams that design and deliver services. They help their teams develop a deep understanding of the people - citizens, businesses or government colleagues - who use a service. Their findings allow their teams to design and build better services more quickly and at lower cost and risk. And to continuously improve services, based on data and evidence.

As a User Researcher you will work in a multi-disciplinary team on a wide range of user research activities. You will work independently, with support and guidance from more senior user researchers.

As a User Researcher at GDS you'll:
* plan, design and prepare a range of user research activities to support the design, development and continuous improvement of government services.
* carry out user research activities from recruiting participants, preparing discussion guides and moderating research sessions.
* lead colleagues to analyse research data and synthesise clear and actionable findings, including working closely with analytics colleagues to create a rich picture of user behaviour.
* communicate user research findings to help the team and wider organisation develop a deep understanding of users and their needs - including presentations at show and tells, designing and maintaining research outputs and creating formal reports.
* work closely with product managers, designers and developers to turn user research findings into stories and actions that lead to valuable product and service features
* mentor and guiding more junior user researchers
* contribute to the wider user research community - including presenting at meetups and writing blog posts

## Who you are
We're interested in people who have:
* experience and understanding of a range of user centred service design and delivery practices.
* the ability to understand what problem your team is trying to solve, and align user research activities to inform decision making and action.
* experience and understanding of a range of user research methods, when to use those methods and how to apply them correctly.
* experience and understanding of a range of techniques for analysis of research data, synthesis of findings, and presentation of clear findings that colleagues can understand and use.
* a good understanding of the diversity of users of government services, and the ability to include many kinds of users in appropriate research activities.
* experience of working with colleagues to plan and do continuous user research in a multidisciplinary team.
* experience of involving your team in research activities, and in analysis and synthesis.
* a good understanding of the social and technological context for government services, and the ability to align user research activities to help their team understand changing user behaviour.
* understanding of agile approaches.
* some knowledge of current technologies used to build and operate digital services, and the different technical roles in a digital team.

The Natural History Museum is both a world-leading science research centre and the most visited natural history museum in Europe. We are at a pivotal moment in our history as we launch a new strategy setting out our role as the natural world faces increasing threats. We will be focusing on your knowledge, team fit and your ability to comfortably design multi-platform experiences (i.e. considering UX across a range of screen sizes and devices).

## How we work together
We organise ourselves into cross-functional squads, with each squad working together on a common product goal. Each squad generally consists of 7 team members - a Technical Lead, 3 Engineers, a QA Engineer, a DevOps Engineer, and you.

* Experience working in an ambiguous domain - you don't always have all the answers you find feasible ways to validate your ideas with a results-oriented and experimental approach.

As a result, employees are empowered to do their best work, without security getting in their way.

## About the job
### Summary
The first duty of the government is to keep citizens safe and the country secure. The Home Office has been at the front line of this effort since 1782. As such, we play a fundamental role in maintaining the security and economic prosperity of the UK.

The Home Office leads on immigration and passports, refugee protection, counter-terrorism, policing, fire services, and crime and drugs policy.

Digital Data and Technology (DDaT) enables the Home Office to keep the UK safe and secure. We design and build the services that help people apply for visas or passports; support policing and counter-terrorism operations; and protect the UK’s borders.

This is an exciting time to be at the Home Office. You’ll have a chance to shape the future and support our mission to deliver exceptional public services that work for everyone.

Our work is guided by these principles:

* We put user needs first
* We value delivery and outcomes over process
* We work in the open

Our flexible working policy ensures a healthy work-life balance. We also nurture talent and offer a broad range of learning and development opportunities that will help you flourish in your role.

We work hard to maintain a positive working culture and are committed to helping you fulfil your potential. We value diversity and provide an open, inclusive and supportive environment to help you do your best work.

You can keep up-to-date with our work on the Home Office DDaT blog.

### Job description
We are looking for a User Researcher who is passionate about what they can bring to delivering better services at the Home Office.

You will work within a fast-paced delivery team - either across several smaller services or dedicated to one larger programme of work. Your research will inform policy, proposition, service, content and interaction design so that digital services work well for users and achieve their policy intent.

As a User Researcher, you will plan, design and carry out research activities to inform the design of government services and help teams get a deeper understanding of the people that use them. You will develop research plans and approaches for a given service. You will use a range of research methods, including usability testing, contextual interviews, and pop up research, and will carry out rapid analysis that involves the wider team whenever possible.

You will communicate insights from research in engaging and impactful ways to delivery teams and stakeholders to drive change and improve government services.

Candidates with exceptional skills and experience may receive a recruitment and retention allowance (RRA) between £2125 - £5000. This allowance is subject to annual review in line with departmental priorities and could be reduced or withdrawn at any time.

### Responsibilities
Your main day to day responsibilities will be:

* Planning, designing and conducting user research and usability testing to understand user needs and behaviours, and support the design and development of government services
* Turning user research findings into actionable insights that inform the design and development of digital services
* Leading on research moderation, analysis and generation of outputs
* Supporting digital delivery teams to build accessible digital services by including participants with access needs and low digital skills in all research
* Working collaboratively in a multidisciplinary delivery team, including designers and product owners, to define research questions, plan research approach and prioritise findings

You will also be expected to carry out the following day to day activities:

* Presenting research findings and related recommendations to team members and stakeholders
* Managing logistics of research sessions, including planning and scheduling sessions and recruiting participants
* Identifying and raising any blockers to research activities

### Essential Skills
You will have a demonstrable passion for user centred design, with the following skills or strong experience in:

* Understanding and applying a range of user research methods correctly for different life cycle phases
* Clearly articulating to stakeholders the benefits of taking a user-centred approach, based on evidence
* Applying ethical research standards and practices to ensure the safeguarding and wellbeing of participants and researchers
* Researching diverse audiences to deliver accessible and inclusive digital services
* Managing, executing and analysing usability testing to deliver valuable user insights that inform decisions
* Communicating research findings in a clear and engaging way that drives change

### Desirable Skills

Ideally you will also have the following skills or some experience in:

* Engaging multi-disciplinary teams with a good research process in agile environments
* Managing workload effectively in response to changing deadlines and priorities
* Mentoring or coaching more junior User Researchers
* Familiarity with the Government Service Standard

### Qualifications:

Desirable but not essential

* A degree in HCI /Cognitive Psychology/ Anthropology/ Sociology/ Computer Science or related field, and/or relevant industry experience

## Benefits
* Learning and development tailored to your role
* An environment with flexible working options
* A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
* A Civil Service pension

## About us
Genomics plc is developing a ground-breaking digital health platform that generates actionable information on an individual's risk for common diseases based on their DNA.  Our platform gives healthcare professionals and individuals insights from complex genomic data that enables them to be proactive and make informed decisions to manage their health.

## What you’ll be doing
As part of the Genomics team, you will play an important role in building a digital health platform that will impact people's lives and their long term health.  The services we are building enable people to understand their risk of common life changing diseases and make decisions with healthcare professionals to take actions that will improve their health outcomes.

## The Role
As our new Senior Product Designer, you will lead the design, user experience and user interface of our precision medicine products. Your work will be the face of our cutting-edge precision health offering, leveraging genetic data to prevent disease and improve patient lives globally. Your role will span the entire product design spectrum, from high-level design strategy and UI/UX design, to working with the front-end engineering team to translate them into software and user testing. 

## Responsibilities
* Design user experiences and interfaces, wireframes, mockups, clickable prototypes and final designs for a variety of precision health products.
* You will have the opportunity to design products for a wide variety of users, including patients/consumers, clinicians, administrators, laboratory managers, and internal audiences, all with the goal of preventing disease and improving health.
* Develop a comprehensive understanding of project and product requirements in order to create reports that are informed by user needs, company strategy, regulatory requirements, and data.
* Run user interviews and user testing sessions.
* Collaborate a team of world-leading scientists and engineers to create new ways to visualize and interact with genetic risk information, genome data, and other pieces of genetic and medical information.
* Collaborate with the clinical and content management team to design a user experience optimized for medical and scientific content, including clinical reports.
* Create effective documentation to describe all variations of a feature’s design and prepare design deliverables for handoff to engineering.
* Present design solutions to stakeholders and precision health leadership, defend design decisions and incorporate feedback into the design cycle.

## Requirements
* Digital product design experience, spanning ideation to implementation.
* Experience with the design of data-driven products.
* Experience with running and assisting usability testing and conducting user interviews.
* A passion for building the future of healthcare.

## Desirable Experience
* Experience with health or scientific data visualisation and design of scientific products.
* Degree in a life sciences, scientific or engineering discipline.
* Experience in designing products in a regulated environment.
* Experience in designing scientific and clinical reports.

## Role-Specific Opportunities and Benefits
* The opportunity to work alongside highly-talented colleagues in a fast-growing company that combines a focus on cutting-edge science with commercial delivery.
* The chance to do work that directly benefits healthcare, and improves people’s lives.
* Dedicated time - for all staff - for hacking on “blue sky” projects and research.
* A compensation

Quest products are highly technical and complex. We need a Product Designer who excels at quickly learning complex systems, then designs the product in such a way that no one else has to go through the trouble of learning what you just did. Your design effectively manages the complexity and reveals an intuitive user interface.

## Job Description

## The UI Toolkit
One of DXD’s most important contributions to J.P. Morgan is the Toolkit—the solution for building multichannel user interfaces at scale that incorporate best-of-breed interactions and visual design. It provides components, patterns and standards for applications that are dynamic, information- and data- rich, highly specialized, and built within the scope of the latest technological trends.

With support from our technology partners, the Toolkit helps deliver cohesive, ADA-compliant experiences across organizational boundaries, products and channels for the Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) of J.P. Morgan. 

## UX/ Product Designer role
Collaborating with visual designers, developers, UX writers and product owners, you’ll play a key role in helping us realize the vision—and define the next generation of user experience.

You’ll work closely with the Toolkit leaders and application teams across the CIB to evolve the design system and to create tools that help our customers drive best-in-class, multichannel product experiences.

Our users have complex, fast-paced, information-overloaded jobs (within an already complex industry). The tools they use must provide benefits without adding to that complexity.

You’ll delve into the problem space by leveraging the various techniques designers have for identifying insights in order to guide product evolution and achieve clear business goals.

You should be highly organized and motivated, have a deep sense of teamwork, and employ a walls-down approach that allows you to effectively collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of smart, accomplished individuals throughout the product life cycle.

* Iterate and validate designs through prototypes and usability testing.

* Take an active role in quality assurance throughout development and deployment.
* Actively support efforts to codify preferred and industry-appropriate design standards.
* Collate and document best-practice examples and guidance that help our consumers effectively utilize the design system.
* Be an ambassador for the Toolkit, promoting its use and driving consistent use of patterns across CIB applications.
* Apply a transparent methodology in order to maintain a feedback loop and develop relationships with our consumers.

## Job Introduction
At BBC Datalab we use data and machine learning to build recommendation engines that serve millions of audience members. We’re looking for a Senior Design Researcher to join our cross-functional team on a 12-month fixed-term contract (or internal attachment) and help us to scale up machine learning within BBC World Service. [https://datalab.rocks/](https://datalab.rocks/)

While you will work day-to-day within Datalab, you’ll receive professional support from BBC UX&D, a department of UX designers, architects and researchers who collaborate closely with product, editorial and technical teams from across the BBC. Working together with users and colleagues, you’ll take a holistic, human-centred approach to help create a BBC that’s truly fit for the digital age.

## Main Responsibilities
As the Senior Design Researcher (Algorithmic Recommendations), you’ll be working with a cross-functional squad within Datalab, focused on delivering great algorithmic recommendations on BBC World Service language sites. You’ll be responsible for shaping and delivering the design research programme in your portfolio.

In your role, you’ll:
* Work with stakeholders and squad members to prioritise research needs, and then define and execute the project’s research programme.
* Draw on your extensive knowledge of different methodologies to make recommendations around where research will deliver the most value.
* Lead complex research projects, working alongside UX&D counterparts in BBC World Service, News, and other product areas.
* Investigate new research or design methodologies and ensure the team are kept up to date with advances within the user experience field.
* Align with World Service Audience Research counterparts and World Service Marketing team.
* Commission and oversee external research agencies inside and outside of the UK.

## Are you the right candidate?
You’re comfortable advocating for the user and their needs. You’ll enjoy building empathy with different kinds of stakeholders, flexing your approach to achieve the best results. You have extensive knowledge of different research methodologies and are able to articulate insights in a way that lands with colleagues and results in real, tangible changes.

You’ve worked alongside designers and product managers to discover requirements in complex environments, and are happy and capable of running multiple projects at once. If you’ve worked with data scientists before, that’s a plus! You enjoy teaching others, and helping teams get more from research. Product Experience Design at Yoto covers a broad church, from UX research to interaction design, prototyping and testing of concepts. The Product Experience team works across the spectrum of touchpoints - from the Yoto website and app to packaging and physical product interaction.

## About the job
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." User Experience Researchers (UXRs) make this possible.

User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers who care deeply about the people who use our products. We play an integral part in gathering insights about product user needs, attitudes, emotions, and behaviors to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other, engineering, and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for our users and Google’s businesses.

As a User Experience Researcher (UXR), you’ll help your team of UXers, product managers, and engineers understand user needs. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. Working with stakeholders across functions and levels, you'll have impact at all stages of product development. You’ll explore user behaviors and motivations by conducting primary research such as field studies, interviews, diary studies, participatory workshops, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis.

The UXR community at Google is unique and will help you do your best work. You’ll have the opportunity to work with and learn from UXRs across Google through regular meetups, mentor programs, and access to internal research tools.

As the User Experience Researcher on the Reliability Infrastructure team at Google, you will help design and deliver the systems and products that will provide consistent and standardized infrastructure for Google Cloud services. Our goal is to improve product quality and increase reliability by helping teams apply Google’s best practices and expertise.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

## Responsibilities
* Define UX research to support product teams in the Reliability 360 organization, researching behaviors and needs to identify critical goals and journeys for our customers.
* Evolve traditional research methods to suit the fast-paced and ever evolving domain of developer experience research.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders, product managers, engineers, and designers to gather insights, build consensus around user needs, and deliver excellent solutions.
* Identify and define new opportunities based on insights gathered.

We are looking for a seasoned UX Researcher to join our team here at Vodafone Smart Tech in London.

This role is a unique opportunity to have a tremendous impact on the Vodafone Smart Tech mission and your chance to grow as part of a progressive design-led team. You’ll be joining a Design and Research community that sits within Smart Tech’s Product Studio. The studio is a community of Product Owners, Product Designers, UX Researchers, and Engineers focused on answering the evolving needs of our modern lifestyles.

We’re motivated by deep empathy and a fascination with everyday living and the opportunities it brings. We work as one in the design process, to find innovations that leverage tech in pursuit of enhancing the human experience through simple, elegant design.

Your role will be to work as part of a closely-knit community to help ask the hard questions, through research, ideation, prototyping, and testing all centered around our user’s needs, behaviors, and motivations.

Together, with your colleagues, you’ll help shape beautiful, intuitive, and accessible market-leading IoT experiences for our international audience.

## What you’ll do here
* You'll work with your product manager and designers to take broad and conceptual ideas, and run research programmes to learn, inform and help designers and product managers shape useful and valuable solutions for our customers.
* You’ll contribute towards and/or lead research projects, end-to-end research programmes - activities will include: competitor & industry research, requirements gathering, ideation & conception, user interviews, moderated/unmoderated usability testing, surveys, diary studies, profile building, analytics review, presenting research findings, and research support to designers and product managers.
* You’ll develop partnerships with peers, supporting those around you from engineers, to product managers, designers .
* You'll work with your partners to lead the research efforts and run end-to-end research from conception, to launch and beyond.
* You’ll actively help colleagues to understand the value of research, provide perspective, and advice. Advocating design to diverse audiences (including senior leaders) through written reports, oral presentations, and other novel approaches.
*  You’ll actively contribute in evaluating the aesthetic, interactivity, and usability of our apps, whilst considering our design principles and brand identity.

## Requirements
* You're a seasoned UX Researcher, 4+ years experience in industry.
* You have 1+ years experience in researching IoT product solutions.
* You have a compelling portfolio consisting of numerous projects showcasing your thinking, contribution, actions, and outcomes.
* You have experience working with agile, lean, sprint-based processes.
* You have successfully supported and/or led the research efforts in the delivery of iOS and Android products, physical products.
* You have a solid skill set across UX Research; planning, recruiting, moderating and testing product experiences, alongside a good understanding of product design practices.
* You’re able to respond quickly to problems at hand and support your colleagues in developing/ researching ideas at pace.
* You have a strong research process, proactively seeking input, perspectives and insight to help iterate upon your concepts and the design confidence to experiment.
* You have the ability to communicate the value of research, championing the user to inform our decisions, whilst balancing the needs of our identity and business.
* You have good communication skills, you are able to articulate your ideas and the goals of your work succinctly and effectively, including the ability to produce written and oral reports to engage with colleagues and stakeholders.
* You are comfortable working collaboratively and autonomously, managing your own time and competing demands and can work with your manager and colleagues within the squad to plan and prioritise work.
* You understand the importance of working with autonomy and as part of a team. You’re able to contribute ideas to the wider community, yet understand the value in working with our design principles and utilizing our in-house research practices.
* Your work is considerate not just to the customer, but to colleagues, you consciously make an effort to follow the set standards within design files and recognise that other colleagues need to be able to work with your projects.

Ready?

Vodafone is committed to attracting, developing and retaining the very best people by offering a motivating and inclusive workplace in which talent is truly recognised and rewarded. We are committed to promoting Inclusion for All with the belief that diversity plays an important role in the success of our business. We actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of our journey.

The Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew (RBG Kew) is a leading plant science institute, UNESCO World Heritage Site, and major visitor attraction. Our mission is to understand and protect plants and fungi for the well-being of people and the future of all life on Earth.

We are working to end the unprecedented extinction crisis and to help create a world where nature is protected, valued by all and managed sustainably. We will achieve these goals by drawing on our leading scientific research, unrivalled collections of plants and fungi, global network of partners, inspirational gardens at Kew and Wakehurst, and our 260 years of history.

Join us on our journey as protectors of the world’s plants and fungi. 

 The Product Designer is responsible for designing our digital products, ensuring that they designed for our users – from initial research and conception through to delivery, and into ongoing iterative improvement. They will take a research-driven approach to determine user needs, and then develop and test design outputs that balance user needs, technical constraints and business goals. This role sits within the Product and Design team, part of Kew’s Digital Experience department.

**All applicants must include a link or file of their work portfolio to demonstrate their design skills across a range of digital products and devices.**

Our fantastic benefits package includes opportunities for continuous learning, a generous annual leave entitlement, flexible working to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance, an Employee Assistance Programme and other wellbeing support such as cycle to work scheme and discounted gym membership. We also offer a competitive pension, an employee discount scheme and free entry into a wide range of national museums and galleries, as well access to our own beautiful gardens at Kew and Wakehurst.

We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from all sections of the community. We guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria for the post.

No agencies please.

## Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
Honeywell is charging into the Industrial IoT revolution with the establishment of Honeywell Building Technology (HBT), building on our heritage of invention and deep, on-the-ground industry expertise. HBT is the leading industrial disruptor, building and connecting software solutions to streamline and centralize the assets, people and processes that help our customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. 

We are building a smarter, safer, and more sustainable world. That’s the Power of Honeywell. Our company invents and manufactures technologies that address some of the world’s most critical challenges around energy, safety, security, productivity and global urbanization. We are uniquely positioned to blend physical products with software to support connected systems that improve buildings, factories, utilities, and aircraft, and that enable a safer, more comfortable and more productive world. Our solutions improve the quality of life of people around the globe and craft new markets and even new industries. As a Fortune 100 company with $40.5B in sales in 2017, Honeywell has established a track record of strong financial performance over time and we about 60 percent of our growth over the next five years is expected to be connected to software. 

 ## As a Senior UX Designer, You will
* Actively engage your product owner(s) to clarify and address key business/customer goals
* Design, implement and verify user interfaces for massively scalable programs and applications desktop and mobile.
* Fluent with design sketching and prototyping tools, (e.g. Sketch, InVision, Figma, Adobe XD, Abstract, etc.)

* Document functional user requirements to communicate design, process, rationale and decisions that direct and support UX/UI and functional design

## You Must Have
* 5-10 years of experience in digital product design
* Experience designing UX including but not limited to: personas, user journeys, functional designs
* Experience designing UIs including wireframes, prototyping, and visual design concepts
* Experience with multi-platform development, including responsive design
* Excellent communication skills, ability to collaborate with engineers and peer teams
* Passion to develop high-quality and intuitive User Interfaces

## We Value
* Experience leading product design teams and projects
* Fluent with design and prototyping tools, e.g., Sketch, InVision, Zeplin, adobe XD, Abstract, etc.
* Knowledge of user-centered design methodologies
* Experience working in Agile product development teams
* Ability to tackle and define solutions, frameworks and patterns for complex problems and use cases for different user profiles in the IoT space.

## We Offer

* Competitive salary.

* A culture that fosters inclusion, diversity and innovation
* Market specific training and on-going personal development

## About Currencycloud
Currencycloud is somewhere where innovative thinking and the power of technology know no limits. We know that the success of the business depends on the people who keep it moving, which is why we are looking for exceptional talent to join our international payments revolution. 

We are an open & collaborative Fintech unicorn that lives and breathes our company values:
Be Human, Better Together and Own it.

## About the role...
We are looking for our first product design hire at Currencycloud. Your mission is to design and deliver a first-class user experience for our customers in collaboration with our product managers and software engineers.

This person will give Currencycloud’s customer-facing business tools a fresh face and help us encapsulate our company values throughout our product, with the ability to articulate the impact of strong product design on our customers and our business.

While UX is an important part of this role, this person should not expect to be able to utilise existing design frameworks or components.

## What you'll get to do
* Improving the customer and end-client experience through design and UX
* Creating key design artefacts including user journeys, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity responsive designs for specific features/products
* Creating a design system, components, and processes
* Collaborating deeply and closely with small, cross-functional, agile teams to rapidly deliver quality working software
* Using research and behavioural data - quantitative & qualitative - to back up your designs
* Championing user-centred design within Currencycloud, including presenting to business leadership to get buy-in for design thinking & user-centricity

## About you

### Experience
* Mid-senior level Product Designer (4+ years experience as a product designer or similar discipline, preferably in a “software-first” company)
* Experience working as part of an agile team
* A good level of technical understanding - preferably having done some web development previously, at least covering the basics of HTML/CSS/Javascript
* Ability to provide justifications for designs/processes
* Ablity to undertake basic quantitative discovery as well as in-depth qualitative user discovery
* Experience with and knowledge of contemporary design best-practices and tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch etc.)

* Bonus: Experience with white-label products

### Personal
* Own It: A high-agency, high accountability person who gets things done
* Better Together: Able to build relationships with colleagues all over the world, collaborating closely to unleash collective intelligence & creativity
* Be human: We like the real, the bold and the brave here at Currencycloud


## Why Currencycloud?
We are a remote-first company; whichever location you’re contracted to, we leave it up to you and your manager to agree on how often you come into the office. To make things easier we offer an allowance so you can create your own working space at home because we REALLY mean it when we say remote first.

Your health and well-being are of paramount importance to us, and so our jampacked employee benefits reflect this!

We offer a competitive salary, an individual learning and development budget, a pension or 401K contribution, mental health days and comprehensive health care that includes annual optical and dental allowances, access to mental health support and a monthly allowance that you can spend on anything health or wellness related!

At the moment we are unable to consider applicants living outside of our entities and we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

Ford X is Ford Mobility’s business incubator. We work like a start-up and unite entrepreneurs, designers and engineers to envision, build and validate new mobility ventures and business models to shape the future of transportation. It’s an exciting time to join as we forge new teams and ventures, as well as embarking on a challenging period of growth

We are looking for a Design lead who is comfortable being self-directed and operating a fast-moving environment tackling challenging problems. An individual who thrives in highly collaborative environments, embraces continuous learning, values a healthy team culture. The selected candidate will be responsible for building out our UX/UI function within this growing part of the business

## What you’ll do
* Developing design systems and customer touchpoints for products: digital, hardware and experiential applications.
* You will have a strong point-of-view on the role that design plays in order to create world class products
* Checking and approving all latest designs across multiple products in your team.
* Driving design function forward by developing new ideas and improving design system
* Experience in a fast-paced, data-driven environment: product companies, growing startups
* Collaborate with various other teams and departments, especially with developing research, to formulate an overall design vision and identify areas of improvement for our business and customers.
* Define and drive the Product Design strategy that integrates with, and informs, the broader Product strategy.
* Engage regularly with Senior Leadership where you will effectively represent design, your team's objectives, learnings, progress and celebrate their achievements.
* Effectively manage performance, provide progression frameworks and opportunities to engage and retain your team of designers.
* Continue to hire to build a diverse and inclusive world-class product design team, with strong vision on how to scale the team effectively.
* Play a critical role in continuing to grow a healthy design culture.
* Work closely with your team to understand business requirements and conduct first hand user research.
* Creating prototypes to test your ideas, challenge assumptions and refine your thinking.
* Translating prototypes and ideas into seamless high-fidelity designs and user-flows.
* Working with our growing engineering team to deliver incredible user experiences

## What we’re looking for
* 5+ years of qualitative research experience culminating in a sound ability to scope a research process, nurture fieldwork, conduct interviews and do desk research.
* 2+ years of experience using human centered design, design thinking principles or methods in a formal, in-person setting
* Education is important to us; ideally, you’ll have a Degree or equivalent in hand, but if that’s not the case (and you have experience/ skills you feel are relevant and beneficial to the role) we’re interested to hear from you

## Minimum qualifications
* Bachelor's degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.
* Experience defining design systems that work across a complex product.
* Experience communicating human centered design processes and research’s role in the design process.
* A portfolio showing experience designing web and/or mobile applications.

## Preferred qualifications
* Demonstrated experience in designing usable web-based interfaces for complex internal systems
* Demonstrated understanding of clean visual design.
* Effective leadership, communication and teamwork skills.

## About the job
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and across teams to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. You’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, and inspired products that people love to use.

The Chrome team works to build the best possible experience for people using the web. We aim to serve the global diversity of human needs, computing norms, and networking conditions, while also pushing the envelope of what’s possible on the web and leveraging the magic of Google.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

## Responsibilities
* Collaborate and build strong relationships with designers, product managers, engineers, researchers, and partnership managers, and developer advocates on Chrome and across Google
* Create artifacts/docs/specs that enable engineers to implement new UIs efficiently
* Provide patterns, best practices and guidance on interaction design for different devices and platforms
* Gauge and iterate on the usability and delightfulness of new and existing surfaces in partnering with user research, product, and engineering

## Job Purpose
We are seeking a Lead UX Designer to work in the Racing team. You will ensure that features on our next racing title are implemented to AAA standards, whilst also breaking new UX ground as we implement cross-platform play in our next game.

You will advise and mentor other UX designers and collaborate with UI artists to ensure our players have a high-quality experience across a wide range of different devices.

## Key Roles & Responsibilities
As a Lead UX Designer, your role will report into our UX Lead in our London Studio. Your role will be to ensure all UX Design is implemented to the highest standards, and will take point on the implementation of cross-platform UX design for our next game.

Breaking new ground: We are a rare example of a game which will allow cross-platform play, and you will 

Leading The User Experience:  You will be responsible for working with multiple feature teams as well as the cross-platform team and ensuring that UX is implemented to a consistent high standard across each. 

Close Collaboration with the UI team: Working in unison with the UI team to deliver a peerless user experience with beautifully crafted visuals free of friction. Defining what is ‘best in class’ for a user experience in a cross-platform, mobile-first game.

Maintaining Interaction & Visual Consistency: Following existing interaction methods you will become a champion for maintaining consistency across all areas of the game. 

Representing The Players’ Needs: You will be responsible for developing the user experience of game content and features that will be enjoyed by many millions of players and a truly international audience.

## Required Experience & Skills 
* Knowledge about, and experience with, contemporary UX design in digital platforms which can be applied to mobile and console games making.
*  A good knowledge of the racing titles, with particular regards to the CSR world.
* An understanding and interest in emerging trends in digital platform UX
* Experience with user research and hypothesis-led user testing
* Real passion for gaming, especially mobile. You can reference the best and worst user experiences and apply the lessons to your work.
* Familiarity with a range of software you are comfortable with rapid prototyping and iteration of ideas, listening to feedback and exploring options to make the game stronger.
* An innate ability to develop prototypes that work across multiple aspect ratios and platforms.
* A passion for investigating new and emerging trends that push user experiences forwards.
* Comfortable with presenting and discussing the ergonomics of screen layout you can rationalise the interaction of every element and propose simple solutions to complex problems.
* You can demonstrate experience of designing for multiple platforms with scalability in mind

## Desirable Experience & Skills 
* Experience creating UX in Console and/or Mobile Games
* A background in Psychology, Human Computer Interaction, Interaction Design or related areas
* Experience with Sketch or similar rapid-prototyping tools
* Unity engine experience

## What Do We Offer?
* Competitive salary, discretionary annual bonus scheme and Zynga stock allowance
* Contributory pension scheme
* 25 days holiday, plus public holidays and Christmas shutdown
* Private medical care and healthcare cash plan
* Life insurance and critical illness insurance
* Discounted gym membership and free weekly yoga class
* Flexible working hours
* Free fruit, snacks & soft drinks provided daily, as well as free lunch on Fridays
* Annual season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme

job-title: Senior Experience Designer - Identity and Nectar
extended-description:
## About Nectar
Nectar ([www.nectar.com](https://www.nectar.com/)) is the UK’s largest loyalty scheme with over 17 million customers. We’re part of Sainsbury’s Group but our brand has its own playful personality. We work closely with some of the UK’s favourite brands like Argos and eBay, along with 100s of other partners from retail to travel and everything in-between.  

We’re on a mission to reimagine the future of loyalty. Think of personalised offers and playful experiences across all our brands and channels. Our customers are ever more app-engaged, and we’re excited about the possibilities that brings. 

Our ambitions are greater still. Nectar Connect ([http://bit.ly/nectarConnect](https://www.nectar360.co.uk/company-news/open-banking-financial-with-nectar-connect/)) uses open banking to give customers the opportunity to get more value for their money through our partners. Our new Insight Platform ([http://bit.ly/insightsPlatform](https://www.nectar360.co.uk/what-we-do/data-and-insights/sainsburys-insights-platform/)) is helping colleagues and business partners to better manage our product range, setting the trend in offering customers ever more enticing, healthier and more sustainable product choices. And, with our Digital Trading Platform ([http://bit.ly/tradingPlatform](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/nectar360_the-digital-trading-platform-activity-6788447442363805696-BanD/)), we’re providing our partners with new ways to engage with customers on other channels including Google, Facebook and Instagram.

Nectar flows through our business from where we source our products to customers’ homes and we’re transforming the relationship we have with our customers and partners. Join us and make life a little sweeter for millions of people across the UK.

As an Experience Designer for Nectar, you’ll also be part of the wider Customer Experience Design (CXD) team and you’ll get the chance to work with other designers, researchers and writers on projects that bring Nectar to life across our different brands. You can find out more about our work, our colleagues and our culture on our Medium blog ([http://bit.ly/ourMediumBlog](https://medium.com/sainsburys-digital-experience))


About Identity:
Identity is the way we recognise and authenticate people ([https://bit.ly/SainsburysIdentity](https://medium.com/sainsburys-engineering/my-id-is-bringing-our-products-closer-together-fdbc988a0103)), giving them a single, secure Sainsbury’s and Nectar identity, which we call My ID ([http://bit.ly/aboutMyID](https://account.sainsburys.co.uk/gol/find-out-more-about-myid)). It’s growing and stretching across our digital products and touchpoints to provide a single sign-in experience and a personal account to manage your address book, payment and more.

We’re excited about how this service will evolve and combine with the power of Nectar to take personalised shopping to a whole new level.

## About this role
As an outcome lead, you’ll make new work happen by being a catalyst for change, working closely with a wider business to drive an outcome-based way of working, thinking strategically across horizons to ensure we are building the right things, whilst collaborating with others to ensure our designs end up in the hands of our end-users.

You’ll be accountable for creating ever better personalised experiences for our customers, by developing our Identity service and utilise the power of Nectar. You’ll be ambitious about how we continually improve what we have today, whilst envisioning the future personalised, Nectar experience and how it flows across Sainsbury’s ecosystem and beyond.

You’ll approach things in a balanced way, considering outcomes, design principles, analytics, customer insight and business requirements. You’ll be thinking strategically and end-to-end of how designs can be translated across all channels, on app, web and in store.

Along the way, you’ll lead workshops, collaborate confidently, and present the objective rationale for your design decisions to influence the best outcomes for customers and the business. 

And as part of the wider CXD team, you’ll be working within a team of 80 designers, and can help shape our culture, evolve our Design System and influence the way millions of customers shop and colleagues work with Sainsbury’s now and in the future. 

## What you need to do
* Drive an outcome-based way of working, thinking strategically across horizons to ensure we are building the right things - Collaborate with product managers and engineers to create outcomes and key results.
* Identify, define and design digital solutions for new propositions, services, products and experience areas that deliver value to customers and colleagues and are directly aligned with Sainsbury’s Group digital vision and KPIs
* Lead all phases of user-centred design through a data-informed, test-and-learn approach
* Champion the voice of the user through your work, organising and conducting user research and user testing to inform concepts and validate designs, and bringing stakeholders on the same journey
* Consider the wider Sainsbury’s Group digital ecosystem when designing concepts and solutions that are aligned with our strategic vision of allowing our customers to shop whenever and however they want
* Lead and manage stakeholders and project teams through a user-centred design approach whilst balancing business challenges and strategic vision
* Run workshops with cross-functional teams to inspire user-centred design thinking
* Inspire, coach and motivate junior members of the design community
* Work with the Guidelines team to continuously evolve the digital guidelines and champion their adoption
* Consistently embed inclusive design principles in your work and encourage throughout the team
* Work comfortably in or out of scrum, but consistently proactively collaborate with cross-functional teams, championing best-practice for design thinking in an agile environment
 
## What we’re looking for
* Wide range of experience as a service, UX, product or UI designer ideally for a big brand
* High level of creativity, problem-solving skills
* Adept at collaborating with and influencing stakeholders through a range of agile methods, including workshops – championing the voice of the customer whilst balancing business objectives
* Utilise a broad range of UX tools and techniques with portfolio evidence of these deliverables
* A thorough technical understanding of inclusive design frameworks
* Expert skills with Figma, Miro and rapid prototyping tools
* Knowledge of best practices and emerging digital technologies and trends
* Wide range of experience in user-centred design and usability best practices
* Methods and practices of usability research and confidence in conducting research and interpreting results
 
## In return you’ll get
* Colleague discount across the multi-brands – Sainsbury’s, Argos and Habitat
* Holiday allowance
* Bonus scheme
* Pension plan
* Special offers on gym memberships, restaurants, holidays, retail vouchers and more

Flexible working and job share conversations are encouraged. Across our multi-brands, we’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer that champions a diverse and inclusive culture. If you’re reading this, even if you’re not 100% sure you’re there with your experience, we’d still love to hear from you. If you’d like to find out more head to [Sainsbury's Digital](https://sainsburys.jobs/roles/digital-tech-data/digital/)

***We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.***

* ***Excellent career progression*** – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
* ***Unrivalled training and development opportunities*** – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
* ***Benefits***- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.
* 
The situation regarding the coronavirus outbreak is developing quickly and the BBC is keen to continue to ensure the safety and wellbeing of people across the BBC, while continuing to protect our services. To reduce the risk access to BBC buildings is limited to those essential to our broadcast output. From Wednesday 18th March until further notice all assessments and interviews will be conducted remotely. For more information go to [https://www.bbc.co.uk/careers/](https://www.bbc.co.uk/careers/)

## Job Introduction
Are you interested in creating design systems that support BBC News, Sport, and the children’s experiences?  Do you want to be working alongside top-class engineers to bring both order and delight to our vast and diverse audience? And are you up for solving difficult problems at scale? 

The Global Experience Language (more commonly known as GEL), is the BBC’s shared design framework. Along with the Core Services team, we are working to measurably improve the way teams create the next generation of digital experiences at the BBC. 

Providing a consistent User Experience (UX) across many BBC services is vitally important. For our audiences, GEL provides ease of use, familiarity, and the confidence to explore more of our digital content. For our design and engineering teams, GEL increases our efficiency and productivity.

You can read about some of the design system challenges we’re solving in[ this article by our talented designers and engineers.](https://www.bbc.co.uk/gel/articles/creating-a-design-system-for-bbc)

The opportunities we have are in the core GEL space and also Core Services.  

## Main Responsibilities
* Be the voice of GEL in project teams, explaining your design rationale to Engineers, Editorial and Product teams.
* Lead the central Core Services UX approach. Helping to create a new more centralised way of working across many teams.

## Job Title
Senior Product UX/UI Designer (70% UX / 30% UI)

## Role Overview
Working in the Global Technology team, creating advanced innovative internal products for our client teams across the media line of business. The role is a hybrid product UX role with a focus on the UX side (70% UX / 30% Design).

The purpose of this role is to design interactive experiences, with all consideration given to the user and usability best practices and the balancing of those with business goals and technical capabilities.

As the Senior UX Designer you will be involved in scoping, designing and evolving a brand-new platform of apps, that strikes a balance between the internal user needs and requirements, and objectives of the business. This role offers a unique opportunity to be part of a new product team, working to shape and influence a product from the early stages.

The Senior UX Designer will have in-depth UCD (User-centred Design) experience working on complex products — preferably in the enterprise tooling/ platform space. Any experience in designing tools with a workflow/ service design angle too is advantageous. The designer will be a true team player; flexible, positive and a willingness to collaborate in varying sized groups — teaming with others from different disciplines. Their attitude and approach to tackling design challenges are probably the most important aspects of this role.

The designer will have worked on projects from inception through to research, testing and delivery. We are seeking candidates who happily get their hands stuck into creating and iterating core UX design deliverables, whether it be user journeys, task flows, system/site mapping, concepts, wireframes or lean prototypes – depending on the challenge at hand.

They will be advocates of a considered design process, yet flexible enough to adapt their approach to deliver artefacts in as lean a manner as possible, in order drive the product forward.

## Key Accountabilities 
* Excellent UX skills across the UCD spectrum, working experience and advocates of evidence-based design decision-making through research and observation.
* In-depth knowledge and evidence via portfolio/case studies of having worked with data, testing, research and analytics
* At least 1 years experience working on SaaS style platforms in a previous role. Proven product/platform design experience is a must for this role.
* 6+ years industry experience working within a digital process/function, either client or agency-side (or preferably a combination).
* Experienced and able to work in each of the stages of product design from discovery and research to design, test and measuring the impact of said solution/idea.
* Experience working with Agile, Lean UX methodologies and concept of MVP.
* Experience or awareness of media (offline/digital media highly advantageous, but not essential).
* Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and internal stakeholders.
* Experience and understanding of design system thinking.
* Basic understanding of Front End technologies: HTML, CSS, REACT, JavaScript would be an added bonus.
* Worked with Product Managers, the business and technical teams to determine different approaches to support business solutions.
* Strong experience in prototyping; including experience with tools like Axure & InVision.
* Excellent core UX/IA-driven skills. This is not a Visual design role.
* We are keen to see portfolios which have detailed examples of concepts, research, prototyping, testing and measurement.

## About the job
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." User Experience Researchers (UXRs) make this possible.

User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers who care deeply about the people who use our products. We play an integral part in gathering insights about product user needs, attitudes, emotions, and behaviors to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other, engineering, and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for our users and Google’s businesses.

As a User Experience Researcher (UXR), you’ll help your team of UXers, product managers, and engineers understand user needs. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. Working with stakeholders across functions and levels, you'll have impact at all stages of product development. You’ll explore user behaviors and motivations by conducting primary research such as field studies, interviews, diary studies, participatory workshops, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis.

The UXR community at Google is unique and will help you do your best work. You’ll have the opportunity to work with and learn from UXRs across Google through regular meetups, mentor programs, and access to internal research tools.

The Google Play Console enables Android developers to launch and manage their apps and games on Google Play, to over 2 billion users. Our team of UX'ers strives to make the app publishing experience simple and delightful. Our team's mission is to empower developers to create the best ecosystem of apps and games

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

## Responsibilities
* Conduct independent research collecting and analyzing user behavior through a range of mixed methods, including lab studies, field visits, interviews, ethnography, surveys, concept evaluations, etc.

* Partner closely with cross-functional stakeholders to understand research needs, craft and execute studies that address priorities in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment.
* Drive change by communicating compelling and actionable findings to diverse audiences. Impact product strategy and design through your research.

## About FX Digital
FX Digital is an award-winning digital agency based in London, specialising in OTT (Over-The-Top) streaming and Connected TV-first application design & development.

It is an exciting time to join our team and help our clients find industry-leading, innovative solutions in the exciting and rapidly growing world of Connected TV.

We currently deliver solutions for incredible brands like Discovery, Eurosport, GCN and the ATP Media, as we continue to work with global sports and entertainment brands, helping them to reach millions of viewers across the world.

## Responsibilities

### User Research
* Run user research projects to support our product and design teams in making informed strategic decisions on OTT solutions.
* Source users matching our clients target audience, run surveys and user interviews to dig deep into users goals, motivations and frustrations. Map out these insights to craft user personas.
* Gather insights through workshops, user interviews, competitor analysis, user testing and other techniques to help inform product & UX decisions. Collate your findings and research to present these back to internal teams and project stakeholders.
* Review our client’s OTT analytics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), take learnings from historic data and identify where there are areas for improvements within the experience.
* Market Research – build up a knowledge base of the OTT industry, ensuring we are up to date with device adoption, user behaviours, pricing points and market trends to ensure we remain at the forefront of the industry.

### User Experience Design
* Run UX workshops and exercises to define the information architecture for our client’s OTT solutions.
* Create detailed and inclusive user flows highlighting key journeys and steps, but also understanding best/worst cases scenarios to ensure a comprehensive picture of the solution is being depicted.
* Through research, data, competitor analysis and conversations, identify unmet user needs and work in collaboration with the Product team to define hypothesis to validate/refute with users to inform the backlog definition & prioritisation.
* Create wireframes and interactive prototypes for OTT solutions that span across mobile, web and Connected TV devices.
* Plan and manage user testing and interviews to gather feedback on your proposed solutions. Collate, summarise and analyse your findings to propose concepts and feature ideas to improve the user experience.
* Ensure our solutions meet accessibility standards providing an OTT experience for an inclusive audience, but also look into what could/should be done from an accessibility point of view on TV to push the boundaries on this front.
* Take a holistic view in your work, think about the bigger picture and how users interact across multiple devices and how these OTT products integrate into the everyday lives of users whilst also being mindful of the business needs and objectives.

### Design Support
* We are a small but growing department. Outside of your core responsibilities, there will be opportunities to support the design function in the business across workshopping, UI and asset creation. This is ideal for someone who wants to focus on user research and UX, whilst getting involved in additional areas of design.

CCleaner Cloud is a cloud-based version of our popular Desktop optimisation tool that is aimed at businesses to make their computers run faster, perform better and last longer from any connected device.  ## Diversity & Inclusion
We work in partnership with [Stonewall](https://www.stonewall.org.uk/) as part of their Diversity Champions program. This is because we believe in a world where all LGBTQ+ people are free to be themselves and can live their lives to the full. Inclusive workplaces have a huge part to play in making this world a reality.

**Macmillan Cancer Support are recruiting for a User Experience Designer to support Macmillan’s digital transformation and ongoing optimisation of its digital product portfolio.**

This is a highly collaborative role working with cross functional teams and stakeholders to deliver user experience design and evolve Macmillan’s digital experience across a number of digital products and product features.

With the opportunity to work in a fast paced and creative working environment Macmillan are seeking candidates who are able to demonstrate their experience of **User Experience Design** articulating the impact of their work against KPIs.

Included in this role we are also looking for candidates who also have demonstrable experience in UX research.  If you have experience in gathering and analysing qualitative and quantitative information, stakeholder interviews, personas, card sorting,  running workshops, usability workshops and testing we would love to hear from you.

It’s a very exciting time to join Macmillan who are one or the UK’s most recognised and trusted charities.

**Want to be part of something special working for organisation making a real difference to people’s lives  - Macmillan would like to hear from you.**

### Easy Apply 
Our application process for this role is simple and quick.
Fill in your personal details, attach your CV, provide any additional information (optional), and submit!

Please submit your application as soon as possible as we reserve the right to change the closing date of our vacancies.

We aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool, reflecting the diverse range of people we support.

We want to make our recruitment processes accessible to everyone, so if there is any way that we can support you to be the best you can be, please contact the Macmillan People Services Team at [PeopleServices@macmillan.org.uk.](mailto://PeopleServices@macmillan.org.uk)
