job-title: User Experience Graduate Pathway – Technology Talent Programme
extended-description:
## In Summary
Love to build a career that’s centred around creating brilliant online experiences for our customers? If you're passionate about design this could be the pathway for you!

## Job Description
As the UK’s largest insurer, a FTSE 100 company and a global leader in our industry, our Technology teams are crucial to our success. We truly believe our Technology community is amongst the most talented and supportive anywhere. Without their skills and ideas, we wouldn’t be the company we are today.  But we’re not the kind of organisation that gets complacent. We want to keep investing in our technology, and more importantly, we want to keep investing in the people behind our technology.   

That’s why our Graduate jobs are permanent from day one.  

**Technology careers for diverse Graduates** New insights, perspectives and diversity of thought are all invaluable to us. Which is why you don’t need to have studied IT previously to join us in Technology. We have Graduates that have studied everything from Music to Maths, from Business Studies to History, and they’re all equally brilliant.   We have a real variety of roles across our technology teams. As long as you’re curious and passionate about technology, then we can teach you the rest – you’ll have a structured training programme and a support network to help you develop.  

**User Experience (UX) Design** is a design process that focusses on designing user interfaces that offer a great experience to its users. From how people access our websites and apps, to their usability and accessibility, it’s our UX teams that are responsible for this. They build a bridge to the customer, helping us to better understand, and fulfil their needs and expectations.   

**As a Graduate User Experience Designer** you will either be based in Norwich or London and will champion the customer and pursue every opportunity to ensure that we’re delivering digital products that address true customer needs. You will be an advocate of user research and participate in such activities during the design process.  You will be given enough responsibility to work autonomously, taking responsibility for the work you deliver with support from others around you in the design team.  You’ll be working on interesting and challenging initiatives alongside a community of highly skilled and experienced technology professionals who will be on hand to support and encourage you every step of the way. This is a brilliant learning environment – a place where everyone is welcome to share ideas, ask questions and seek out advice. Where you’ll be based: We offer our Graduate User Experience (UX) roles in our Norwich or London offices.   At Aviva we ask our teams to think about when they work in the office and when they work at home. This will vary depending on your role. We call this SMART working. When you join us, your leader will take time to discuss this with you and to agree what works for you, your team and the organisation.   
 
### About you   
To join us as a Graduate, you’ll:    
* Already have a degree, in any subject, or you will be graduating this year    
* Plus you’ll have at least five GCSEs or Scottish National 5s at A -C or 9-4 grade (or equivalent), including English and Maths 
* Ideally have some design experience and an understanding of UX principles either through your studies or outside interests 
* Be a force for change and improvement – whether it’s through your studies, your work experience or your outside interests, we’ll want to see how you’ve helped make things better   

You will also be a confident communicator with strong analytical and problem-solving skills, a love of learning and a commitment to continually developing yourself. And it goes without saying that we’ll be looking to see that you have a genuine interest in technology.    If you’re also a natural problem solver who loves to learn new things, we think you’ll fit right in.    

### What will you get for this role?   
* Starting salary from £28,000 (depending on your skills, experience and qualifications)   
* A permanent role from right from the outset – you’ll be taught and developed from the ground up by tackling real responsibilities rather than undertaking role rotations
* Professional qualifications aligned to your role 
* A caring, welcoming culture complete with wellbeing programmes, flexible working and an in-built support network, including buddies and mentors – many of whom have been with us for years 
* A great support network including leaders, mentors and buddies who will help you grow into your role
* A holiday allowance of 29 days, plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to five additional days  
* An annual performance-related bonus and pay review   
* Generous defined contribution pension scheme   
* Plus plenty more 

### The recruitment process
We’ll assess your strengths as well as looking at how well you connect with our values throughout the process.   The process itself involves:  

* Making an online application – this will include answering a short questionnaire and attaching your CV 
* If you pass the initial CV screen, you’ll be sent some online tests
* Pass these, and you’ll have a telephone interview with us 
* And if you do well in these, there’s an assessment day 

We are looking at a September 2022 start date for all roles.  

## Additional Information
### Proud to be diverse 
We care deeply about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We want our employees to bring their whole self to work and that starts with you. We interview every disabled applicant * that meets the minimum criteria for the job. Just send us an email once you’ve applied stating that you have a disclosed disability and we’ll make sure we interview you. We’d love it if you could submit your application online but if you require an alternative method of applying, please contact the recruitment team by sending an email to [avivaearlycareers@aviva.com](mailto://avivaearlycareers@aviva.com).

* As defined in The Equality Act 2010. By ‘minimum criteria’ we mean you should provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required and have the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential to perform the role.

Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, go to [remote and flexible working](https://jobs.natwestgroup.com/pages/remote-and-flexible-working) to find out more.

This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.

Join us as a UX Researcher
* Join an open and collaborative environment, where you’ll be helping to develop a programme of research for product-related human-centred design (HCD) challenges
* You work closely with other members of the product team to deliver consistent, efficient, and enjoyable experiences
* This is a great opportunity to develop your knowledge and skills while making a real difference for our customers

## What you'll do
As a UX Researcher, you’ll be defining and conducting investigations into customer experiences for our current and prospective products. These will be delivered across multiple platforms, such as desktop, web, mobile and tablet devices and for both browser-based experiences and native apps.

Working with product owners, UX designers, visual designers, and other stakeholders, you’ll be using a variety of techniques and tools to elicit the insight necessary to make informed and HCD decisions.

Additionally, you’ll be:
* Helping to develop high level storyboards and journey mapping that communicate the goals, motives, and means by which groups of customers use, or will use, a given product
* Providing HCD recommendations based on research insight or recognised principles in psychology or ergonomics, supporting the design of solutions
* Using multiple research techniques and providing the design team with multiple sources to understand and empathise with customer or user needs
* Participating in content and application audits, including gauging the usability of new and existing products and making constructive suggestions for change
* Acting as a champion of HCD by recommending the best possible UX research practice, principles and processes

## The skills you'll need
You’ll need to have experience of supporting HCD processes and using both qualitative and quantitative research techniques to address design challenges for new and existing products or services. We’ll expect you to have the ability to use UX design research tools, including DScout, Optimal Workshop, Dovetail, Usability Hub and video editing software. You’ll also be creative in your problem solving and be able to work well as part of an Agile team environment.

We’ll also be looking for:
* Knowledge of research techniques, including UX evaluative testing, focus groups, diary studies, ethnographic observation, survey design and co-creation workshops
* The ability to deliver relevant and effective insight under varying project constraints
* Experience supporting HCD processes for both desktop and mobile, by leading research design and creating research material
* A background in human-computer interaction, psychology, sociology, or a related field
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills across all levels with an ability to champion design thinking and influence key stakeholders

If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the [Disability Confident Scheme](https://jobs.natwestgroup.com/pages/inclusive-hiring) please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

At Digital Identity Net we are empowering everyone to control their online identity. Our digital identity solution, OneID®, allows people in the UK to prove who they are online.

We are building a diverse team to make a positive impact on society, by simplifying and securing peoples digital lives. We value our people and the unique perspectives they each bring. If you want to make a difference and use digital identity to improve society, we want to hear from you regardless of experience or qualifications.

We have specific vacancies open but welcome submissions from anyone who believes they share our vision and can contribute to our team.

## What you will be doing
* Designing consumer facing products for mobile, web and app-based customer experiences, working closely with the Product and Development teams to design and deliver products that will delight our customers
* Conducting design and usability research to optimise our products and ensuring they are the best versions they can be
* Working from concept through to delivery of new products, helping design and storyboard the products to sell the vision to stakeholders both internal and external
* You will be responsible for organising the design system for the business, building wireframes and prototypes and the design assets for the products themselves
* Occasional collaboration with the marketing team to provide design assets

## What we are looking for in you
* You are evangelical about the products you deliver, both within the business and when facing clients and users 
* You are an out-of-the-box thinker, able to use creativity to solve problems
* You revel in the responsibility of designing solutions, the success of which the entire company depends on
* You are a collaborator, generous about sharing what you know and always open to learning from others 
* You will be comfortable working as part of cross functional teams working towards common delivery goals
* You are ready to lead the direction and evolution of the products through research and design
* You are focused and driven on delivering the product vision, able to prioritise your work and the work being delivered by the team around you 
* You will be looking to build a team around you as more product lines are developed

## Qualification & Experience (nice but not required)
* Proven Experience of working as a UI/UX designer or as a Service Designer in an Agile software development environment  
* Strong portfolio of previous design projects
* Ability to present yourself with confidence across all levels of the corporate hierarchy  
* Fluent/Expert level in industry tools Figma/Sketch/InVision
* Comfortable using Adobe Creative Cloud
* Ability to create thoughtful designs backed by user-testing and research and build for a digital environment, experience preparing files for handover to the development team
* Strong understanding of design thinking and branding principles

We are committed to supporting career progression, and our competitive salary includes flexible working, 25 days annual leave + bank holidays, and an attractive package of personal & social benefits. By joining us you will be joining a small team of bright, passionate and enthusiastic people working to change the future. 

 If you don’t quite fit the above but think you will be great in this position then let us know, we’d love to hear from you. Email recruitment@digiidnet.co.uk 

Digital Identity Net is an equal opportunities employer and we cherish diversity and inclusion. We are passionate about respecting all individuals irrespective of their gender, background, race, religion, or orientation.

Digital Identity Net is a disability confident employer.

## Company Description
**Protect a national treasure**
We can offer you a role in a global business with a fascinating product and an innovative mindset. Come and join us.

We’re the world’s leading diamond company – a unique luxury business that thrives on the creativity, passion and knowledge of our people.

To push our company forwards, we always need to think differently. We welcome people who think rigorously and aren't afraid to challenge assumptions.

In return, we provide you with the space and support to grow and achieve your ambitions.

## Job Description
You will be an ambitious self starter who is a great communicator. You will be joining a unique team that is part of both corporate affairs and diamond trading. Joining a truly collaborative group where you will build and develop your existing UX skills. If you have social media knowledge along side photoshop and Figma – we want to speak to you!

Your role will:
* Utilise a range of prototyping skills to clearly communicate design concepts to users to rapidly gather feedback and iterate on designs
* Creates user flows and wireframes when building user interface mock-ups and prototypes
* Supports implementation of designs by providing production-ready specifications in collaboration with engineers
* Organises and designs projects in a way in which allows short feedback cycles by releasing small improvements often
* Ensures business and technical context in which the designed system must operate is considered in the design proposal
* Stays up to date with latest design & technology trends and can adapt to new software where it benefits the team

## Qualifications
### Formal qualifications
* Experience working both as an individual contributor within a design team and leading design projects from idea through to implementation.
* Experience in designing UX and UI for both desktop and mobile applications
* Outstanding portfolio of prior work that demonstrates strong user-centred as well as visual design capabilities across a range of different projects
* Deep knowledge of visual design theory (e.g., typography, colour theory, composition, iconography, etc.) and excellent analogue visual communication skills (e.g., sketching)
* Advanced software skills, with experience of Figma, Miro and Adobe CC (Photoshop, illustrator and InDesign)
* Expert understanding of information architecture, workflows, concept development and interaction design
* Experience working in agile environments
* Social media management experience

### Additional requirements
* Assists in the growth of the brand by raising awareness through various social media platforms
* Maintains and evolves the Gemfair website content
* Designs beautiful and engaging advertising creative in support of marketing initiatives across video, digital, social media and print to support Gemfair as a corporate brand.
 
## Additional information
### Who we are
De Beers Group is a company with a rich history and a sparkling future.

Since 1888 our experts have searched the world for nature’s most precious gem. Our diamonds bring beauty to the world. But we think they can do so much more. We want our diamonds, and our business, to make life brilliant – for our people, our customers and the world around us.

Venetia Mine is part of De Beers Group Managed Operations Business which integrates mines, operations and support functions in the De Beers Group producer countries of Canada and South Africa to shape a safe, sustainable future for De Beers Group’s people, shareholders, communities and partners.

### Safety
Safety first is a way of life for us.  We are unconditional about the safety, health and well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. We aim to lead the industry by investing in innovation to protect people, who are at the heart of our business. Our high performing teams take accountability for their own and others' actions, work collaboratively, and always show care and respect.

### Inclusion & Diversity
We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential.

## Summary
At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences.  
We are seeking an experienced UX designer to join the Classical music team. 

Apple recently acquired Primephonic, the music streaming app specifically designed for classical music lovers. 

This role could be based at either our Apple office in London or Amsterdam. 

You will have a passion for tackling complex problems and crafting elegant, simple solutions that surprise and delight. By constantly focusing on the user, you’ll create products that are not only amazing to look at, but also intuitive and useful to billions of people worldwide. 

Join this team if you’re committed to making each human interaction — visual, audial, and haptic — amazing for our customers.

## Key Qualifications
* Demonstrable professional product design experience with a focus on the UX design of mobile apps and services.
* An exceptional eye for detail, creative and innovative problem solving, and fluency in iOS, Android and Web design patterns.
* Ability to clearly communicate concepts and designs through sketches, wireframes, high fidelity comps, and interactive prototypes.
* Demonstrable fluency with Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite and other design tools
* Willingness to work in ambiguous situations, creating clarity without direction and defining software products from the ground up.
* Flexibility and enthusiasm to work in an iterative design process, motivated by group critique.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present work to large groups and executives.
* A passion for Apple, its products, and its customers.

## Description
You will be working closely with cross-functional teams to provide UX expertise and new perspectives specifically for Primephonic, Apple’s recently acquired Classical Music streaming app.

You should possess extraordinary User Experience and User Interface design skills, as well as user-centered design principals. 
You have an affinity for consistency, color use, typography, and a keen eye for subtle details.  
While exercising a good eye for aesthetics, you are able to grasp and distill highly complex issues and translate them into clean, focused, understandable solutions.   

This position requires flexibility and the ability to clearly communicate product direction under tight deadlines. Strong communication skills are required, as well as coolness under pressure, creative problem solving, attention to detail, and the ability to work in an ambiguous, evolving project space.

## Additional Requirements
English fluency required. Additional fluency in another European language is preferred.
We are looking for an Online portfolio that clearly demonstrates past work history. Please apply by submitting your CV including a link to your work (don’t forget to share with us your password!)

## About the job
### Summary
The first duty of Government is to protect the public. Since 1782, the Home Office has led work to keep the country safe from those who seek to do it harm; in doing so, we make a vital contribution to HM Government’s plan for a stronger, fairer, outward-looking and united Britain.

The Home Office covers three systems: Homeland Security, Public Safety and Borders, and Immigration and Citizenship. These systems work collaboratively to deliver our cross-cutting priorities, whilst providing increasingly efficient and secure services for the public.

Digital Data and Technology (DDaT) enables the Home Office to keep citizens safe and the country secure, as well as at the front line of making the Home Office a modern and capable department at a time of unprecedented global change.

Within DDaT, Data Services and Analytics (DSA) runs one of the most advanced data analytics centres in Government. This sits at the heart of the Home Office’s transformation into a data-driven Department.

In DSA, we design, build and operate services that are critical in helping the Department achieve its mission. You will be responsible for helping build and deliver business-critical analytical data products used across the Home Office. Our success depends on our ability to exploit the latest technologies to create leading-edge, world class solutions whilst ensuring they are secure and resilient.

### Job description
This key leadership role requires an exceptional individual to put user-centred design at the forefront of the Home Office’s digital transformation. We need you to help make sure our services work for everyone, by default.

A strong influencer, you’ll play a key role in managing, developing and supporting DDaT staff across the department. You’ll also set the direction for what good looks like in a large government department.

You’ll use your leadership experience to coordinate user researchers across the department, and represent your professional community to service teams, stakeholders and senior management.

You’ll also be a central figure in the cross-government user research community, sharing your experience, ideas and understanding of best practice with colleagues in other departments.

In line with much of the private sector you’ll be in post as Head of Role for 2 years. You will then move to an operational role where we will want you to continue your positive impact on our transformation, making the most of what you’ve learned.

As Head of User Research, you’ll define principles, processes and standards to ensure all Home Office services are accessible, inclusive and meet user needs. You’ll also build capability and consistency through regular peer reviews and the Research Ethics Board.

You’ll ensure user researchers work closely with content designers and interaction designers to define user needs and make evidence-based decisions. You’ll empower them to challenge assumptions, by supporting their research findings, and explaining the impact of those findings to senior management.

To promote quality and consistency, you’ll ensure that user researchers follow the GDS Service Manual and assess services against the Digital Service Standard.

This post is eligible for DDaT RRA. Successful candidates with exceptional skills and experience may apply for a Recruitment Retention Allowance between £3000 and £9000. This allowance is subject to an initial review within six months of taking up the post and thereafter an annual review in line with departmental priorities and could be reduced or withdrawn at any time.

### Responsibilities
Your main day to day responsibilities will include:
* Working with stakeholders at all levels to raise awareness and visibility of what good user research and user-centred design looks like, and drive positive change.
* Working with the Deputy Director for Research and Design and the other Heads of Role to drive transformation across Digital, Data and Technology, leading on strategic projects to drive this change.
* Ensuring current and future resourcing needs for user research across the Home Office are met, by upskilling, hiring new talent and allocating resources as required.
* Developing recruitment and retention strategies, establishing consistent job descriptions, skills frameworks, career pathways, learning and development plans and performance incentives.
* Defining, developing and embedding standards, guidelines and processes that promote best practice and consistent ways of working and assure quality of user research across the Home Office.
* Building an inclusive community of practice that enables User Researchers across multiple projects and business areas to share ideas, discuss best practice and proactively help and support each other.
* Line managing, supporting and mentoring user researchers and UCD Operations staff, providing them with guidance, training and constructive feedback.

You will also be expected to carry out the following day to day activities:
* Assessing Home Office services to make sure they are accessible and meet relevant government and industry standards.
* Being an active leader in the cross-government User Research community, sharing advice and best practice with Heads of User Research in other departments.
* Being a thought leader, blogging and presenting at conferences to raise the profile of user research both within and outside government.
* Creating and maintaining learning and development plans that promote a common skills framework and support career progression.
* Building capability and assuring quality through regular peer reviews and retrospectives to support strong outputs from multidisciplinary teams.

### Essential Criteria:
You’ll have a demonstrable passion for user centred design, with the following skills or extensive experience in:
* Understanding organisational strategy and objectives, aligning user research activity across multiple projects simultaneously and adapting to changing priorities.
* Advising on the application of appropriate user research methods across different life cycle phases, as well as extensive hands on experience in applying these methods.
* Establishing an effective user-centred design culture in an organisation, convincing senior management of the value of a user-centred, evidence-based approach to influence organisational strategy and priorities.
* Building and leading a community of user research specialists that work across a range of services or programmes of work, and assuring the quality of their research.
* Defining ethical research standards and practices to ensure the safeguarding and wellbeing of participants and researchers.
* Researching diverse audiences to help teams deliver accessible and inclusive digital services.
* A degree in HCI/Cognitive Psychology/Anthropology/Sociology/Computer Science or related field, and/or relevant industry experience.

### Desirable Criteria:
Ideally you will also have the following skills or some experience in:
* Coaching and developing skills of team members, supervising the work of others.
* Using strong communication and negotiation skills to build support for a user-led approach in complex organisations.
* Working in an agile development environment, creating new digital services as part of a multidisciplinary team.
* Familiarity with the Government Service Standard.

## Benefits
* Learning and development tailored to your role
* An environment with flexible working options
* A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
* A Civil Service pension

## Things you need to know
### Security
Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is [security check](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-security-vetting-advice-for-people-who-are-being-vetted).

[See our vetting charter.](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/vetting-explained-and-our-vetting-charter/the-vetting-charter)
People working with government assets must complete [basic personnel security standard](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/government-baseline-personnel-security-standard) checks.

### Selection process details
This gives us the best possible chance of finding the right person for the job, drives up performance and improves diversity and inclusivity.

As part of the application process you will be asked to complete a CV and Statement of Suitability (Personal Statement) (Max Word Limit:1000).

Further details around what this will entail are listed on the application form.

Please note your statement of suitability should be aligned to your motivation for applying to this role, and evidencing how you meet the essential criteria listed on the Job Specification.

The sift will be based on the Suitability Statement. The CV is for information purposes only and will not be marked

Candidates shortlisted will be invited to an interview which will be experience based questions. Candidates will also be asked to complete an exercise as part of the interview. No prior preparation is required.

### Sift and Interview dates
The sift will commence 12th November 2021.

Interviews are expected to take place from 29th November 2021.

We are closely monitoring the situation regarding Coronavirus, and will be following Central Government advice as it is issued, as such you will be invited to attend a video interview utilising Skype for Business or Microsoft Teams.

We will try to meet the dates set out in the advert. There may be occasions when these dates will change. You will be provided with sufficient notice of the confirmed dates.

PLEASE NOTE: Due to time constraints we may not be able to offer alternative interview date(s). It is therefore expected that candidates who are successful at sift stage will make themselves available during the above time frame given.

### Further information
For meaningful checks to be carried out, individuals need to have lived in the UK for a sufficient period of time to enable appropriate checks to be carried out and produce a result which provides the required level of assurance. You should normally have been resident in the United Kingdom for the last 3 years if the role requires CTC clearance, 5 years for SC clearance and 10 years for DV. A lack of UK residency in itself is not necessarily a bar to a security clearance and applicants should contact the Vacancy Holder/Recruiting Manager listed in the advert for further advice.

Please read the essential skills for this position carefully. We will only consider those who meet the listed requirement.

If you have previously made an unsuccessful application for a role with the same essential skills and are not able to demonstrate how you have developed these skills since your last application please reconsider applying as your application is unlikely to be successful.

A reserve list of successful candidates will be kept for 12 months. Should another role become available within that period you may be offered this position.

We often have similar roles at different grades. If a candidate is suitable for a similar role or a lower grade than they have applied for, we may offer the candidate that role without the need to go through further selection process providing the role has the same Behaviours and essential criteria.

Every day, Home Office civil servants do brilliant work to develop and deliver policies and services that affect the lives of people across the country and beyond. To do this effectively and fairly, the Home Office is committed to representing modern Britain in all its diversity, and creating a welcoming, inclusive workplace where all our people are able to bring their whole selves to work and perform at their best.

We are flexible, skilled, professional and diverse. We work to recruit and retain disabled staff and area Disability Confident Leader. We are proud to be one of the most ethnically diverse departments in the civil service. We are Stonewall top 100 Workplace Equality Employer and a Social Mobility Foundation top 75 employer.

New entrants are expected to join on the minimum of the pay band.

Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening, subject to a check on the Internal Fraud Database (IFD). This check will provide information about employees who have been dismissed for fraud or dishonesty offences. This check also applies to employees who resign or otherwise leave before being dismissed for fraud or dishonesty had their employment continued. Any applicant's details held on the IFD will be refused employment.

For further information please see the attached notes for candidates which must be read before making an application.

Existing Civil Servants should note that some of the Home Office terms and conditions of employment have changed. It is the candidate’s responsibility to ensure they are aware of the Terms and Conditions they will adopt should they be successful in application and should refer to the notes for candidates for further details.

Transfer Terms: Voluntary.

If you are invited to an interview you will be required to bring a range of documentation for the purposes of establishing identity and to aid any pre-employment checks.

Please see the attached list of Home Office acceptable ID documents.

Any move to the Home Office from another employer will mean you can no longer access childcare vouchers. This includes moves between government departments. You may however be eligible for other government schemes, including Tax Free Childcare. Determine your eligibility at https://www.childcarechoices.gov.uk

### Reasonable Adjustments

## Who we are
Vanquis helps people who are excluded by mainstream banks take control of their financial situation. Whether they’re new to credit or need a hand rebuilding their credit file to manage life better, we make sure our services are straightforward and suitable for them to succeed.

We’re here to put people on a path to a better everyday life, not just our 1.7 million customers but our colleagues too. And we’re proud of the difference we make. 

## You and your team 
At Vanquis, we put the needs of our customers at the centre of every decision we make. As such our researchers are key people within the team. They help us understand our customers, they guide our product teams, design teams, and content teams. They are the voice of the customer. They are pivotal to our success. The User Experience Researcher’s (UXR) main role is to help the business understand our customers at the personal and behavioural level, so that we may produce products and services across all relevant channels which behave as our customers need. The UX Researcher will do this primarily by increasing both the quality of, and types of, user research employed both pre and post design. And they use the outputs to create resources which help manifest tangible improvements.

In your day to day role you will:
* Plan, design and conduct the usability testing process from developing user recruitment through to test moderation, analysis, and reporting.
* Conduct research to gather insights for new product and concept developments.
* Work closely with the product designers, turning insights gained from user research into formats to enhance organisational understanding of our users – such as personas and user journey maps
* Present findings and related recommendations and customer insights to senior decision makers.
* Promote a culture of team involvement in customer research while growing the research capability within the organisation and mentoring and managing those researchers.
 
## What you’ll bring to the team
Working within the UX and Design team you will be vital to how we evolve our services, features and improvements. You will carry the voice of our customer and provide the evidence we need to help contribute to the direction of travel. You will work closely with the entire digital team including analytics, designers, developers and business analysts.

*  A background in growing user research within an organisation.
* An understanding of user needs for transactional and complex user journeys.
* Conducting user interviews and working directly with customers.
* Experience in using evidenced user needs to influence senior stakeholders and acting as a persuasive advocate for those needs.
* Both quantitative and qualitative data experience and a background working with designers to produce UX artefacts (wireframes, content hierarchies, etc).
 
 ## Why Vanquis?
Our colleagues are the most important part of delivering our purpose to put customers on a path to a better everyday life. If it wasn’t for their amazing efforts, ideas and energy we wouldn’t be the successful business that we are today. So we offer an attractive, competitive salary and benefits package for everyone including:

Are you a Product Designer looking for your next move?

## About the job
As a Product Designer (UI/UX) working within our agile teams, you’ll be integral to the transformation of our product development effort, focusing on delivering a consistent and human-centric approach to UI and UX design across our portfolio.

As a core member of our patient experience team, you’ll act as the UI/UX lead for our in-house mobile app, creating assets and a common design language for future development of our product roadmap. You will also be working across sprint teams to transform digital experiences for our employees, therapists and business partners.  The role will be both hands-on and strategic as you contribute to the future vision of our brand and products and align this to our wider business objectives.

At Monese, we push the boundaries every day to help people build themselves a better future.

We’re the mobile app alternative to banks, empowering hardworkers and heavylifters all over the world to thrive. Think gig workers, side-hustlers, go-getters, and all those working towards achieving their dreams.

With over 2 million sign-ups across 31 countries, we’re here to build a community where no doors are closed – and we’ve been named ‘Best Challenger Bank' in Europe along the way.

It’s not easy to make big changes in the world, but we’re looking for the right people with enough ambition to help us go the distance.

## What you’ll be doing
Here’s how you can join us on our mission:

We’re looking for a User Researcher to lead the research across several aspects of our core product. The impact and remit of the role is huge, with lots of opportunity for future growth.

If you are passionate about designing a unique product with millions of signups across the UK & EU that helps people become more financially resilient and reduce inequality, this is the place.

* Take ownership of the full research cycle - from establishing the research question and scheduling the participants to provide answers and presenting insights back to the team.
* Take an integral part in researching the user’s needs, conduct surveys, interviews, user testing, internal & external workshops and more.
* Work closely with the design team, developers, product leads and other cross-functional teams.
* Writing and refining user stories, journey maps and other documentation
* Review analytics to enhance customer experience, improve conversion and increase retention.
* Clearly articulate a POV around UX topics, industry trends and business objectives.

## What we’re looking for from you
* 1 to 3 years experience of conducting user research, either as a researcher or a designer.
* Good knowledge of qualitative and quantitative research methods.
* Ability to find rich patterns and insights from qualitative and quantitative data.
* Keen interest and knowledge of UX principles.
* Ability to manage projects, meet deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* A passion for finding customer problems to solve, through user-centric design.
* Capable of deriving meaningful insight from data and various research sources.
* Review analytics and various monitoring tools to inform how we can enhance the Monese customer experience, improve conversion, increase retention and make usability improvements.
* Can comprehend complex systems, predict edge cases and provide relevant solutions.
* Fluent in English.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work well within a team.
* Organised, eager and a fast learner.

## What you’ll get from us
We love what we do, and we want to make sure you do too! Here are a few of the benefits we offer:

* An unrivalled opportunity for growth at one of Europe’s leading tech startups
* A flat structure with open communication where everyone has a voice
* The chance to make an impact by helping to build a product used by millions of people across the world
* A huge amount of autonomy and trust in a motivated international team
* The opportunity to travel between our offices and collaborate across teams, cultures and communities (as travel corridors open)
* A stack of modern technologies, including a MacBook as our hardware of choice
* Generous stock options and highly competitive salaries
* 25 days of holiday every year to recharge your batteries
* A learning and development support scheme with up to 10 days worth of paid time off per year
* Flexible working between the office and home + flexing hours to fit the demands of life
* Fun team events, activities, and office parties to enjoy with your colleagues
* Your own Monese VIP account for free
* A great employer pension contribution
* Salary sacrifice options including a cycle to work scheme and season ticket loans
* Enhanced and inclusive Family Friendly policies
* Enhanced Sick Leave policy
* Generous referral bonuses for your equally talented friends or ex-colleagues

*We’ve got even more benefits in the pipeline for the end of this year including private medical cover, an increased employer pension contribution, access to a wellness platform and more!*

## How to join us
Sound like a role you want to get on board with? Click on the link to apply and send your CV and cover letter over to us!

At Monese, we’re an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We believe in employing a diverse workforce and making it central to our success.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a mid-to-senior UX Designer to join BMJ's UX & Research team (Co-Lab). Come and help us understand user needs to design and develop products, features and services that healthcare practitioners love. Join us and you’ll make a significant contribution to BMJ’s vision of ‘Creating a healthier world’.

The UX Designer will lead on UCD thinking and UX activities for BMJ Best Practice, our flagship digital product; covering continuous improvement, new avenues of value and the award-winning app.

 We are looking for people who can solve problems using data, research and experience testing with an understanding of front-end and design concepts to create engaging experiences that are commercially successful.

## Responsibilities
* Promote a user-centred design (UCD) approach to support BMJ’s portfolio, drawing on the necessary UX methods and tools relevant to any given project
* Take complex requirements and create conceptual designs and user journeys to solve usability issues and customer problems
* Plan and conduct user research and usability testing for gathering insight on user needs and behaviours, both face-to-face and remotely.
* Challenge ‘inside-out’ thinking and the “we’ve always done it this way” attitude.
* Facilitate multidisciplinary teams to identify and understand market/user problems
* Ensure products are designed and developed accessibly and inclusively
* Present progress on projects and research findings in a concise and compelling way to large groups and senior stakeholders
* Interpret web analytics data to help discover the ‘who’ and the ‘what’ so that we can establish the ‘why’ and the ‘how’.

## Qualifications
* Balance the needs of users with those of the business while considering technical constraints
* Think people first so that solutions work across appropriate environments and device-types
* Highly skilled in interaction design; rapidly putting user needs, stakeholder requirements and usability best practice into a justifiable design (sketch, wireframe or prototype) and communicating this to non UX teams and eliciting feedback from end-users
* The ability to understand complex scenarios and translate into conceptual designs and user journeys via clickable prototypes to test and iterate with users
* Support, influence and convince Product Managers to consider the needs of their users and customers above their own ideas and opinions
* Experience in, and advocate of, working in a Product delivery environment using agile methodologies.
* Multi-platform experience across all devices
* Significant experience with wire-framing/prototyping tools e.g. Axure, Figma, InVision, Sketch
* Experience in remote usability testing methods and tools
* HTML/CSS skills a huge bonus as is A/B and MVT experimentation experience
* In-depth knowledge of digital disciplines (including audience identification and analysis, targeting, experience design, digital production and online analytics).
 
## Why should you apply?
BMJ is a global healthcare knowledge provider with a vision for a healthier world. We share knowledge and expertise to improve healthcare outcomes. 

You may know us as the publisher of one of the world’s most cited general medical journals, The BMJ. We also publish over 70 specialty journals, many of which are the most influential titles in their field. 

 We also offer digital professional development courses and clinical decision support tools to help medical institutions and clinicians tackle today’s most critical healthcare challenges.

 Evidence underpins everything we do – it’s what makes us one of the world’s most trusted knowledge providers. And the figures speak for themselves. More than 50 million users from over 150 countries access our websites every year.

 BMJ is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the British Medical Association (BMA), with nearly 500 employees worldwide. Our head office is located within the Grade II listed BMA House in Euston, London, with more offices in China, India, North America, and Wales. 

**At BMJ we take equal opportunities very seriously, diversity and inclusion are more than just words, they are an organisational priority. We are building a culture where everyone feels able to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We encourage applications from under-represented groups and we are a Disability Confident Committed employer.**

**You will be able to join any of our employee-led networks focusing on: Gender, Cultural Diversity, Sexual Orientation, Mental Health and Well-being, Parents and Carers and Age.**

 **We offer flexible work arrangements to all our employees.**

Those who come to work with us are assured of a rewarding career in an increasingly global company. In return, we offer a great place to work with a wide range of benefits, including: 

* Twenty-five days holiday entitlement plus bank holidays, a BMA Day the opportunity to gain more holiday entitlement through long service employment
* Additional days’ leave for moving house, volunteering or getting married 
* Onsite gym, fitness classes and subsidised canteen and cafeteria
* Double matching employer pension contribution, up to 12%
* Multiple discounts through MyReward employee benefits platform. 
* Season ticket loan, gym membership and cycle to work scheme 
* Seven x salary life assurance cover
* Regular social events, diversity and inclusion groups, and charity fundraising initiatives to get involved in

**Are you looking to make a difference? So are we...**
Thanks for stopping by! We’re Doctor Care Anywhere: a leading digital platform, with a clear vision to radically transform the future of healthcare – and that all starts with our brilliant team.

From doctors and designers to software developers and marketers – we’re proud of our people, who love working together to enhance patient experiences for the better. It’s why every year, we help over 2 million people speak to a GP by video or phone, anywhere in the world.

Our story started back in 2013, but as we continue to rapidly grow, we’re looking for the very best talent to help us achieve our ambitious goals.

If you’re highly motivated, hard-working and ready to dream big – while having lots of fun at the same time – then we want to hear from you today!

## Your new role:
We’re looking for an experienced UX designer who is passionate about solving complex problems that will help to shape the future of digital healthcare and improve the lives of our patient's. You will work closely with a small team of designers and researchers as well as product managers, developers and stakeholders from across the business to collaboratively craft
human-centered solutions to a variety of problems across multiple products and services. Everyday is different. Everyday is exciting.

## Requirements
### The key tasks in your new and exciting role with us
* Work with our users, product teams and stakeholders to understand problems (and opportunities) and devise elegant solutions, across web, mobile and more.
* Use your solid grasp of user-centered design to lead collaborative product discovery efforts.
* Facilitate workshops and design sprints both remotely and in-person.
* Become the voice of the user for your product area. Make that voice heard.
* Plan, design and moderate usability tests, interviews, surveys, polls and more
* Work with product squads to define UX outcomes, metrics and opportunities to improve outcomes for our users.
* Work with product analysts and UX researchers to join the dots between quantitative and qualitative data and derive key user insights that enable product teams to make more informed decisions.
* Spread the good word about user experience. Not just to those in your team, but everyone across the organisation

### Hopefully a description of you and your experience
#### Must have
* You have hands-on experience of a broad range of UX Design methodologies, with examples of previous work that you can show us. (Please include your portfolio in your application)
* You are well versed in User Centered Design processes and comfortable leading on collaborative product discovery
* You can visualize experiences in a number of ways, from sketching to prototyping, journey mapping to story mapping. And you’re confident applying the best approach for the task at hand.
* You’re a strong communicator. A storyteller. You make the complex simple and know how to communicate effectively with multiple groups from business stakeholders to users.
* You love talking to users. Be that through interviews, usability tests or any other opportunity you get.
* Your work is rooted in data. And you are competent at deriving actionable insights by connecting both quantitative and qualitative data.
* You are passionate about learning, and stretching the boundaries of what a ‘UX designer’ does/is.
* You have a genuine enthusiasm for tech and product design with a good awareness of innovation in tech.
* Finally, you are UX champion. You’re passionate about evangelising your craft across the business and experienced at educating, training and mentoring others to help the whole company mature.

#### Nice to have
* You can turn your hand to a bit of UX copywriting and content creation when needed
* You have some knowledge / experience of service design
* You have some knowledge / experience of conversational design
* You have experience of agile product development, product management and/or writing code
* You have experience and/or a passion for working in digital healthcare

## Benefits
### Why you want to work here
We understand the importance of good health and happiness for our patients and our employees. You can expect to be supported and valued as a member of our team and have the freedom to make the most of your role and careers with us! As part of that, as an employee you will have access to:

#### Benefits
* Free Private Medical Insurance
* Doctor Care Anywhere subscription for you and 5 members of your friends or family
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays
* Annual company bonus
* Bike2Work scheme
* Enhanced Maternity Leave

#### Other plus's when at DCA
* 4 x charity days per year
* Flexible working environment - It's important that you work wherever works for you. The office is a collaborative space where you will be needed for your input occasionally, but will have a mix of working in the office and working from home.
* Progressive environment with a focus on wellbeing
* An environment where the ‘sky is the limit’ offering career opportunities and development
* Open, transparent and dynamic environment, trusted to work independently but with a great team around you

FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.

## Equal Oppotunities Statement

## Before Applying
Through your application, we want to understand the skills and experiences you have that make you the perfect fit for this role and for FARFETCH. The UX/UI designer is going to take a pivotal part in creating and managing the experiences of our customers and users of the system.

The UX/UI designer will bring the best practices of UX research and implement them together with the Product Managers.

Based on the strategic goals of Fixflo, UX research and inputs from the wider business, the UX designer will create and test the experiences our customers and users of the system will love.

The UX/UI designer will support the Product team in achieving the business outcomes by designing the experiences within Fixflo products.

The UX/UI designer will work collaboratively with colleagues and end-users in order to accurately design useful features, communicate and present the designs.

The UX/UI Designer is expected to
* Work with the Product Managers and the wider team to create experiences that achieve the outcomes defined by the Product team.
* Carry out the research necessary to make the right design decisions
* Illustrate design ideas using easy-to-understand visual tools in their arsenal
* Create UI mockups and prototypes that explain the functionality that achieves the outcomes of the user
* Work collaboratively with product and development teams to make sure implementing the designs is feasible
* Advocate for user research practices within the organisation
* Maintain current and aspirational User Journeys for the product
* Carry out the UX audit of the system and maintain and collaboratively prioritise the UX debt backlog
* Participate in user research carried out by the product team
* Liaise with a range of stakeholders (internal and external) to solicit feedback and suggestions to improve the experiences within the product
* Create the actual designs that reflect the experiences of the users within the product

The UX/UI Designer will be supported by the Product Owner, CTO, graphic design, marketing, testing, customer support and development resources.

Outcomes:
* There is a shared understanding and prototypes of what great user experience looks like
* New experiences within the product are designed in a holistic way that solves the user’s problem they were set out to solve
* Necessary User Research practices are introduced
* Development teams and Product Managers are involved throughout the design process
* The designs are actually feasible to implement
* There is a prioritised UX debt backlog to refer to

## Requirements
### The successful candidate must
* 2-5 years of proven working experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar
* Portfolio of design projects to refer back to
* Demonstrable experience doing user research in collaboration with Product Managers
* Ability to design experiences delivered via software holistically
* Pragmatic and agile approach to building out experiences
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills
* Experience creating UX fundamentals (User Personas, User Journeys, Jobs to be done)
* Superpower to select the most appropriate research method pragmatically
* Working knowledge of wireframing, prototyping and design softwares
* Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Be willing to travel to visit customers on premises and connect with them digitally
* Have a working knowledge of agile software development principles

### Ideal candidates will have
* Connected their work with the business outcomes
* Built out research practices across the team
* Advocated for User research as a basis for creating experiences
* Received feedback from customers about a product
* Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency

## Our ideal colleague
### Critical competencies (soft skills)
* Attitude
 * Efficiency (can produce significant output with minimal wasted effort)
 * Honesty/integrity (does not cut corners ethically)
 * Follow through on commitments (lives up to verbal and written agreements regardless of personal cost)
 * Intelligence (learns quickly)
 * Attention to detail (does not let important details slip)
 * Persistence (demonstrated tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done)

 * Teamwork (works well with others to achieve a collective goal)

* Drive
 * Enthusiasm (exhibits passion and excitement over work - a can do attitude

* Coachability
 * High standards (expects personal performance and team performance to be nothing short of the best)
 * Openness to criticism and ideas (solicits feedback and reacts calmly to criticism or negative feedback)

## Benefits
What's it like working at Fixflo?

* We're a fun team of friendly, supportive and interesting people who work hard because we love what we do, but we also enjoy a good laugh and have great banter (if we don’t say so ourselves!)
* Our team are very sociable and get on like a house on fire - we are always planning different ways to keep connected especially since things have moved to working remotely
* Your ideas really do count and will make a visible contribution to our growing company
* Commitment to personal development - we want to help you grow!
* We are dog friendly - this doesn’t mean much right now but when we are back in the office we want to see all the doggos

*Please note that we will be working remotely until sometime in Q3 2021 (as of 15/07/21)

And what about benefits?

Other than working for an exciting growing company in London, we also offer:

* Competitive base salary
* The opportunity to have input into the accelerating growth of the company and to work directly with the executive team
* Gym pass
* Health insurance
* Flexible working
* First Thursday of the month drinks, Friday drinks and lots of socials (think Graffiti workshops, cooking classes, boat/karaoke parties, Halloween quizzes) (We are doing our best to adapt to remote events)
* A fun work environment with great people

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

## How do I apply?
* Submit your CV and cover letter (p.s please tell us why this role was of interest to you!)
* Please include the words “Fixflo November 2021” at the beginning of your cover letter. If you do not then your application will not be considered and you will not receive a response.

Please view our privacy policy [here.](https://www.fixflo.com/fixflo-privacy-notice-for-job-applicants/)

Gravity Sketch is a category leader solving the challenges faced by teams that design 3D products (check out a quick video of the product in workflow [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15Rg9yoyRoY)). The platform is changing the way companies like Ford and Reebok carry out their day to day design work, accelerating their creativity and the product’s time to market. We’re starting to see that being highly skilled in Gravity Sketch is important for new hires in the [adidas/Yeezy](https://jobs.adidas-group.com/adidas/job/Footwear-Designer-YEEZY/719094501/?feedId=301201&utm_source=j2w) design team sitting alongside tools like Adobe’s Photoshop. We take a B2C approach to B2B, nurturing a community of over 75,000 highly engaged design and engineering professionals using the product to redefine their 3D design workflow.

We’re a team of 41 based across the US and Europe. We may be geographically spread out, but we’re tied by the common mission of radically changing how teams communicate ideas spatially and expressively from anywhere.

## What skills are we looking for?
An experienced Senior User Experience Researcher to help build and shape our user research function and be an advocate for user research and user experience design across the company. You’ll primarily spend your time working with our Product Management team on company level projects & strategy, creating some of the foundational elements required to help inform and guide our delivery teams.

We want you to be the voice of UX best practice and to lead on creating ResearchOps processes that balance this and our needs, as well as training other people in the company (not necessarily just researchers) in how to get the most out of their time with our users.

You’ll be comfortable designing research activities working with a range of methodologies, and supporting others to do the same. You’ll be motivated to collaborate, and be an expert in facilitation and leading groups to unearth insights and test hypotheses.

You’ll be confident working with a range of stakeholders, and able to be credible and influential with senior colleagues. You will be able to bring both analytical rigour and creative stretch, and help teams to apply these insights in design and delivery.

Ideally you’ll have experience of working in agile software development environments and understand the way in which this affects how user research is undertaken and how collaboratively the team needs to work together.

## Some of what you’ll be doing
* Building and embedding a UX function & ResearchOps into the company.
* Helping the company better understand its users - from enterprise business users to artists - and bringing their needs and problems to vivid life.
* We’ve got an exciting challenge when it comes to user research as our users move between web, VR applications, computers/tablets, VR headsets and back again - sometimes all in a single workflow.
* Developing scalable processes and systems for feedback collection, synthesis and insight dissemination - helping the whole company better understand our users.
* Guiding engineers, designers and product folks involved in the discovery and research process within the delivery teams.
* Working closely with the product, design and engineering leads on discovery to understand the data and the research and how they relate to give actionable insights.
* Diving into how our product is used, to influence the research and solutions we pursue - highlighting key areas to tackle digitally inline with the company strategy.
* Work with the team to identify and highlight which problems have higher priority, and break them down into the outcomes we’re looking to achieve.

## What type of person are we looking for
Someone who is curious, with a passion for learning about people through research and who wants to dive into the details of how they think and behave, coming out with the evidence to showcase your thinking & ideas. You are positive and unafraid to ask a lot of questions and a strong believer in ‘Show, don’t tell’.

We want to benefit from your experience and expertise, and need someone who can learn our context and adapt that experience accordingly to create something that’s fit for purpose while defining what UX means for us as a company.

## Requirements

### You will likely be / have
* A proven UX Researcher with 4+ years experience mostly in a tech / software environment working with agile development teams. Start-up experience a definite bonus.
* Hands-on and practical portfolio experience of B2B / Enterprise SaaS or similar.
* Ideally a formal UX qualification such as NNg certification or a HCI background.
* Driven to understand people’s needs and helping design technology that is intuitive, innovative and drives the right outcomes.
* You will have an experience of using a variety of methodologies in real world scenarios, everything from qual / quant, ethnographic / longitudinal through to mental models, card sorts and moderated / unmoderated usability testing.
* The ability to balance both attention to detail and a view of the big picture.
* Energised by diversity and thinking outside of normal conventions.
* Comfortable with owning outcomes and driving your own work and super passionate about the user and their pivotal role to play in shaping our company's product offering.
* Experience of integrating UX work and activity into agile sprint methodologies.
* A strong communicator and presenter both written and verbally - we’re a global team but our language of communication internally & externally is English so this needs to be fluent.

**This role can be fully remote (UK or Europe based), and we also have our office in Brixton, London, which you are welcome to use as much or little as suits you best.**

## Benefits
* 25 days paid holiday (+ local public holidays)
* Flexible working
* £1,000 (or equivalent) budget per year for professional development
* Enhanced parental leave policy (maternity and paternity)
* For UK employees we’re set up with Cyclescheme & Techscheme
* We’re building a great work culture & environment - we work hard but also know how to have fun too, with regular team socials, lunches, company trips, etc.
* Top spec IT equipment

job-title: IT User Experience Lead I - Finance
extended-description:
## What You'll Do
You will be responsible for driving the experience of the Finance tribe to our BCG employees. You will work as a part of a multi-disciplinary team as the UX Lead focused on Business Intelligence & Analytics squad.

The team is in the early stages of building a centralized Business Intelligence & Analytics function that will simplify and automate information delivery—providing advanced insights and analysis to support decision making.  To date, the team has launched and operationalized several global-scale products and dashboards, enhancing how our leaders engage in information to manage the business.  The next wave of digital reporting is underway which will help to unlock further value for BCG’s leadership and functions with best in class business intelligence and analytics. 

You will have the unique opportunity to work on multiple high-visibility projects that support our BCG employees. We're looking for a creative, service-design oriented individual who can find ways to help our employees.

On the product team, the UX Lead will be responsible for three key things:
* Work together with the product owner for the creation of the UX design (iteratively)
* Collaborate with the rest of the team for the execution of the design vision and illustrate how the experience journey improves over time
* Work as an integral part of an Agile team leading innovation on new digital solutions and products that deliver insights and analytics to help BCG’s leadership make informed and better decision.

To support your responsibilities on the product team you will:
* Create new and improved visual & interaction designs for internal BCG’s finance products used by our strategic team globally. 
* Maintaining the BCG brand’s language as well as creating engaging, usable, and beneficial interactions for the users of the Finance tools. 
* Drive and synthesize customer discovery and understanding through contextual interviews, job shadows and usability studies with employees across the company, learning how employees engage and collaborate across a variety of business capabilities and technical systems
* Facilitate design thinking and working sessions across multiple disciplines to build shared understanding, consensus and forward progress against deliverables
* Create service blueprints, process flows, information architecture diagrams, wireframes, prototypes or other artefacts required to build shared understanding across multiple disciplines
* Collaborate with other UX Design professionals to establish and document best practices for consistently gathering and detailing customer understanding
* Create sustainable and effective mechanisms for evaluating delivered solutions

You should be comfortable jumping straight into the wide range of design tasks as part of an agile, globally dispersed team. On-the-job learning will go hand-in-hand with guidance and formal training opportunities. You will work on a range of projects and support extended teams with design best practice to enable us to continue keeping our employees at the centre of everything we do. You can expect to have an impact at BCG from Day 1!

## You're Good At
* Being curious about people, their behaviour and the digital landscape.
* Understanding UX Research and incorporating this into you work 
* Absorbing large amounts of information and use it to produce simple designs
* Developing wireframes, visual mock-ups and user flows that effectively communicate design vision and user interaction
* Creating rapid prototypes to validate design concepts with stakeholders and users
* Reviewing and proposing ways to improve and simplify existing designs
* Recognizing and predicting use cases and user interaction and incorporating them into designs
* Prioritizing and organizing complex sets of information
* Having an eye for detail; a drive to take initiative beyond your normal duties; strong listening, organisational, and analytical skills.
* Having a clear understanding of “good” vs “bad” design, and why
* Incorporating use cases, personas, and user behaviour into elegant designs

## Job Description
### Octopus Marketing 
The marketing function at Octopus is a “COE” (“Centre of expertise”). This means that all the brand, marketing and comms activity across our financial services businesses and parent company ultimately sits in one team, and reports to a single Marketing Director. This role sits within the Marketing Centre of Expertise and will work with working across a range of the Octopus Brands including: Octopus Real Estate, Octopus Investments, Octopus Ventures and Octopus Giving. 

## Role Purpose 
To scope and implement an Experience Design strategy as well as build an accompanying Experience Design team, fit for a dynamic and entrepreneurial B Corp that is looking to have a genuine impact on the world. 

The potential impact of this role is huge, with scope to increase the remit from UX to include CX over time. Our goal is to deliver a cutting-edge customer experience. To achieve this, you will collaborate closely with our in-house design studio and content teams. 

This role is equal part strategic, hands-on doing, whilst managing a small high-performing team. You'll love this role if you’re passionate about improving customer experience, raising brand awareness with niche audiences (preferably with a B2B focus) and helping us future proof our digital channels. 

## What You’ll Do 
* Set the Experience Design strategy in conjunction with Marketing, the Design Studio, business stakeholders & Product teams 
* Lead on UX design and research methodologies, managing small but talented team of designers 
* Take ownership of and develop our websites and product in-house design system 
* Maintaining and progressing our suite of high-performing, template-driven websites as powerful tools for sales and marketing 
* Cultivate an industry-standard audience research process to allow the team to validate their ideas with our target audiences and identify the key insights and how to translate them into design decisions 
* Champion the practise of test and learn – using usability testing and analytics to measure and optimise key journeys through our digital touchpoints 
* Deliver and facilitate effective workshops across the experience design process to keep teams aligned and engaged, as well as making sure your team has all the information they need 
* Managing the expectations and requirements of a wide-ranging set of senior stakeholders within Marketing, Sales and Product.

## About Nesta
We are Nesta, the UK’s innovation agency for social good. We design, test and scale solutions to society’s biggest problems. Our three missions are to give every child a fair start, help people live healthy lives, and create a sustainable future where the economy works for both people and the planet.

For over 20 years, we have worked to support, encourage and inspire innovation. We work in three roles: as an innovation partner working with frontline organisations to design and test new solutions, as a venture builder supporting new and early stage businesses, and as a system shaper creating the conditions for innovation.

Harnessing the rigour of science and the creativity of design, we work relentlessly to change millions of lives for the better. Find out more at [nesta.org.uk](https://www.nesta.org.uk/)

## About Collective Intelligence
Nesta’s Centre for Collective Intelligence Design helps create new ways for communities to use technology to harness their insights, ideas and power to act on the problems that matter to them and create the futures they want. We know well-designed systems can help promote healthy collective action at scale, but too often technology is designed to solve the needs of individuals or large organisations.

Our mission is to design digital tools and products that allow communities to respond collectively to challenges, and that help public and voluntary sector institutions strengthen trust and collaboration with citizens.

We work with Nesta’s mission teams and external partners to help them understand where and how collective intelligence approaches can help address the problems they’re working on. We apply collective intelligence design - which brings together insights from diverse groups of people, with new sources of data (such as sensor or mobile phone data) and digital technologies (including AI) - to develop bespoke solutions to those problems. We use rigorous research methods to test, learn and evaluate each solution.

## The Role
Nesta is looking for an exceptional end-to-end digital product design lead to develop new collective intelligence solutions, advance our work on collective intelligence design, as well as influencing and mentoring others. At the heart of CI design is the ability to effectively combine crowds, data and new digital technologies to tackle complex social challenges. This is a unique opportunity to apply, shape, codify and spread an emerging area of innovation practice. The role of the CI product design lead is to draw on, apply and further develop the method of collective intelligence design, building our key resources including the [Collective Intelligence Design Playbook](https://www.nesta.org.uk/toolkit/collective-intelligence-design-playbook/) and the [Future of Minds and Machines](https://www.nesta.org.uk/report/future-minds-and-machines/) report. This includes bringing together and facilitate experts from a range of disciplines across Nesta - including data science and engineering, behavioural science and participatory approaches - leading the design and prototyping of new ‘CI’ solutions for Nesta’s missions and external partners. As part of an interdisciplinary team the Lead CI designer will work with the Centre’s researchers and grantees to analyse cutting edge practice and methods, and then turn these insights into codified frameworks, processes, methods and tools for real-world application.

You will be responsible for:
* Leading the research, design, testing and delivery of CI solutions that help deliver social impact on issues from reducing household carbon emissions to tackling obesity
* Researching and identifying strategic opportunities for potential new collective intelligence solutions for Nesta’s mission areas and external clients
* Developing new product/solution concepts, drawing on a wide range of collective intelligence methods and extensive knowledge of existing solutions
* Overseeing and managing the work of CI design team members
* User experience design, including: user research, UX flows, wireframes, prototyping, testing
* Visual interface design, including branding and aesthetics
* Interaction design, including: application design, high-fidelity prototyping, human-computer interaction
* Quality assurance for all products developed by the CI Design team, and working with the Directors to oversee the portfolio of solutions.
* Product strategy and leadership, ensuring the vision and strategic goals for the product are clearly articulated and understood by all product team members
* Developing and maintaining product roadmaps, ensuring they are informed by user insights and focused on outcomes
* Documenting insights from testing and user research, synthesising and sharing results with stakeholders
* Designing and delivering CI design workshops with key target communities and for Nesta’s mission teams and external partners
* Working collaboratively with the Centre’s Principal Researcher, and wider CI networks to analyse cutting edge practice, identify where further research is needed, and develop a programme of experimentation with new methods
* Designing and delivering capability building programmes that enable colleagues and partner organisations to use and embed the principles of Collective Intelligence Design into their work.
* Leading some business development activities.
