## Job Introduction
**Design with People in mind.**

As we emerge out of the impact of 2020 and 2021, we at the BBC want to shape a creative golden age, set up a creative renaissance. Chief amongst our ambitions is to truly connect with our audiences emotionally and a strong and joint up digital user experience is key to that.

We’re a small cross discipline team that makes a big impact and make personal experiences possible across all BBC services. So, our Audience Platform’s services include BBC Account, recommendations, notifications, and participation services such as voting. We work with teams across the BBC such as News, Sport and Sounds.

## Main Responsibilities
No two days are the same; with interactions and collaboration from Product Managers, Delivery Managers, UX Architects and Researchers, Software Developers and others. You'll be working in a cross functional way exploring what's possible, how to better connect and for you, principally, maintaining a human-centred focus methodology in creating the best user experience.

We work on a fun portfolio including our wider User Experience and Design (UX&D) family at the BBC where we design everything from iPlayer on TV to virtual reality experiences. This offers you great opportunities to collaborate with other UX practitioners and of course have fun in creating excellent human interactions and a joint up digital user experience.

You'll:-

* Instigate projects, prioritise your own workload, and plan the work of other UX colleagues in your team.
* Engage the wider team and key stakeholders in the user-centred design process, ensuring that user insight is at the heart of design decision making.
* Inspire and encourage UX&D colleagues to create coherent user experiences across multiple screens.
* Line manage, mentor and develop UX&D colleagues, inspiring them to grow.
* Shape briefs for user research to make sure we’re meeting real user needs.
* Do all this with a view to achieving a single, seamless service across all BBC products on web, mobile and TV.
* Support a positive working environment that considers the needs of a diverse team.

## Job description

As Ably enters its next stage of growth, we’re looking for talented and curious engineers to help us build and deliver the platform to power synchronized digital experiences in realtime for one billion devices every month by 2023.

Our everyday digital experiences are in the midst of a realtime revolution. Consumers expect realtime digital experiences as standard and synchronized data in realtime is business critical for many organisations. Yet, at the same time, organizations don’t have the in-house capabilities nor the time to do this efficiently at scale. That’s where Ably comes in.

We provide a suite of APIs to build, extend, and deliver powerful digital experiences in realtime for more than 250 million devices across 80 countries each month. Organizations like Toyota, Bloomberg, HubSpot, and Hopin depend on Ably’s platform to offload the growing complexity of business-critical realtime data synchronization at global scale.

But we can’t rest yet. And we’d like your help.

To see what life’s like at Ably, check out our careers page at [ably.com/careers](https://ably.com/careers) and read the story of how [Ably's core values came to be](https://ably.com/blog/ably-values).

### What we do
Ably’s engineering team is deeply technical, collectively bringing a wealth of experience and broad technology skills across infrastructure, security, distributed systems, and much more. The quality of the product we produce is what excites and motivates us each day. If you enjoy solving hard problems and want to build the infrastructure for the future of the internet, then you'll love working at Ably.

### In this role
You will be responsible for turning Ably’s services into something developers love and want to use. You will be the expert of our user’s pains, needs and goals. You will understand their journey within the product and know how to reduce friction and pain points. You will ensure the user experience is delightful and that we obsess about our developer’s experiences.

### Day to day, you will
* Constantly evaluate the UX effectiveness of Ably’s existing products and identifying any design debt for the team to tackle
* Research our users and their goals to understand their needs and pains
* Partner with the Product Manager and the team in product discovery to identify the best solution for a customer problem
* Deliver UX artefacts to support the team’s vision, strategy or tactics, like user journeys, wireframes, personas
* Feed from, and contribute to, a centralised Design System
* Support the engineering team in delivering solutions by answering questions around design and interaction
* Ensure that the quality of our UX (visual and usability) is considered when releasing and launching new products and/or features

## Requirements

### It would be great if you
* Knowledge of what great products looks like, and the ability to visualise them
* Extensive demonstrable experience in UX Designer role or similar
* Experience working with a technical product or technical users
* Experience of doing user research, interactive and visual designs
* Worked closely with engineering, embedded in the team looking at product discovery and delivery.

### It would be nice if you have
* Have experience in running experiments or tests with users like A/B testing or rapid prototyping
* Have experience in running workshops for discovery, and user testing
* Have experience working on technical interfaces like IDEs, Command Line Interfaces and APIs (in any role)

### What’s it like to work at Ably?
Ably is entering a new phase of growth led by an experienced senior team. You’ll be part of a successful, highly motivated, and extremely collaborative team.

To provide the infrastructure required for the next generation of the internet, to tell the world about it, and to support everyone inside Ably to do so we hire people who are ready and capable of taking on challenging problems in a high-growth environment.

We want to work in a company of inclusive people who treat each other well. To really thrive at Ably, you’ll need to believe in and be prepared to do your work in line with our values, which are:

* **Open for all.** Open is a mindset. When open, we’re better collaborators, communicators and creators. Whether open source, standards, or protocols, open hearts, minds, and eyes. It’s better when it’s open.
* **Bias for action.** We avoid analysis paralysis at all costs. We lean into doing in order to move us forward. When we have enough of what we need to act, we act.
* **Even the best do better. **We want to be the best - but that doesn’t mean we rest when we are. Improvement and growth - true betterment - is an ongoing journey. One fuelled by curiosity and taking risks.
* **Technology needs humanity.** Our technology means little without people - whether that’s how we treat our colleagues, or how we design developer experiences. Being human matters.
* **Dependable by default.** Dependability is integral to our mission and technology, but being dependable starts with our people. When we care enough to take real ownership of our products and problems - all else will follow.
* **Bold creativity wins.**When viewed through a different lens, what stands in the way can become the way. The bigger the challenge the easier the choice: bold creativity will always move us forward, create better outcomes, and set us apart.

### What’s in it for you?
* [A great company culture](https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Ably-Reviews-E2184188.htm)
* Share options
* The chance to learn and grow with a fast-moving company, supported by a learning budget that gives you access to professional training, events, conferences, workshops etc.
* Remote first: Unless you want to pop into our communal office space in Shoreditch, London, you’ll work from home most of the time, apart from when we have planning sessions and Summits. Travel to the office is at the employee's expense, apart from when we have Ably Summits
* Your choice of high quality tech kit to work on
* Home workstation set up budget of £500, plus an annual top-up of £150
* Regular company away days and social events
* Friday need-to-know drinks and snacks
* Private health insurance, including Doctor@Hand
* Access to private and confidential coaching with [Sanctus](https://sanctus.io/)
* 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme with AXA

Fresh Egg are looking for a User Research and CRO strategist to fulfill a vital role in the delivery of user testing, as well as other user-centred and data driven projects. This is a great opportunity to join an award-winning agency, establish your career in this field and learn from experienced professionals, whilst working across a varied and interesting mix of clients.

The successful candidate will sit within the conversion services team and will report into the UX Research Director. They will work closely with the wider team and with clients to define and deliver user research projects, to support on impactful conversion optimisation strategies and will also support the growth of the service area within the agency.

This role requires an individual who is user focused, a team player, well organised, with a high attention to detail who is prepared to build trust through hard work, effective communication and a desire to learn and continually expand upon knowledge in this subject area. We don’t expect candidates to know or have done it all, Fresh Egg is a supportive environment where continued learning and team work is actively encouraged to ensure we get the best results.

You’ll need to have a passion for delivering exceptional experiences to users, but you’ll also appreciate the value of using real user feedback and data to support your ideas. You’ll need to be prepared to experiment and learn. You don’t see blockers where others might, you just see opportunities to innovate around them. 

## What you will be doing
You’ll work WITH our clients (not for them), and you’ll be supported by an amazing team of user research specialists, conversion specialists, account and project managers, digital consultants, designers and developers. You’ll work to analyse, understand and solve user problems and realise client objectives. 

### User research / User testing
You’ll talk to real users to gather real user feedback and use analysis to ensure unbiased and balanced insights.
* Uncover the ‘why’ behind a usability or conversion issue evaluating & validating user experiences
* Deliver generative research for new digital product solutions
* Assist with and conduct qualitative research activities such as manual (heuristic) UX reviews, user testing, card sorting, tree testing and user feedback surveys
* Review and analyse qualitative data to help build a complete picture of a user experience and to enable relevant and impactful solutions
* Conceptualise and design (wireframe or rough mock-up) proposed solutions that meet the criteria of the hypothesis, taking additional input from clients and internal Fresh Egg teams where relevant

### Conversion strategy
* You’ll conceptualise solutions, split test them and report on how awesome your ideas proved to be.
* Interrogate data, user behaviours and audience needs to build a true picture of performance
* Pool results from research to construct informed and high-quality hypotheses that recommend solutions to remove specific conversion blockers and/or enhance persuasive signals
* Use in-depth knowledge of target audience groups, their motivations and fears to construct optimised journeys from first touch point to conversion, and beyond
* Work with designers, developers and account directors to implement experiments and to overcome and resolve complex web development challenges
* Refine and develop optimisation strategies in line with client goals and changes in their environment

### Analytical
* Review various quantitative data to help identify where customers are experiencing usability or conversion blockers 
* Prioritise hypotheses that are to be split tested by analysing and scoring them against various criteria 
* Monitor the progress of tests, interpret their results and draw additional critical insight from them by analysing the deeper segment data once tests have completed

### Technical
* Create test briefs that communicate all aspects of a test to the client and to the design and development teams involved
* Communicate and agree upon the technical solution with developers and with the client
* Set up robust split tests using a testing platform and carry out quality assurance testing

### Communication / client focus
* Report to clients and internal Fresh Egg stake-holders on the progress and results of experiments, providing clients with accurate and understandable information and reports
* Demonstrate commercial awareness to leverage the most relevant methodology for the client’s specific objectives
* Maintain and develop client relationships to meet/exceed KPI targets

## Experience and skillset 

### Essential
* Experience working in an online or digital role (agency or client side)
* Experience of qualitative data capture techniques, such as user testing, site surveys, stakeholder interviews etc.
* Evidence of user testing projects, gathering real feedback about online user experiences
* Understands the core principles of UX and CRO and how they can be applied to web properties to improve performance
* Experience with web analytics tools and able to draw insights from data 
* Data analysis and data manipulation skills e.g. using MS Excel
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent time management and organisation 
* Self-motivated to deliver high quality work in a fast-paced environment
* High attention to detail
* Analytical, yet creative
* Passionate about the industry, willing to learn and actively keeps their knowledge up-to-date

### Desirable
* Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery would be beneficial but not essential
* Comfortable communicating complex technical solutions to a mixed audience with varied levels of understanding
* Working knowledge of Google Analytics 
* Experience of creating innovative and elegant web solutions to resolve conversion issues 
* Knowledge or experience in using a testing platform to run conversion tests
* Experience and involvement in website development projects
* Experience in interpreting conversion test results and using them to make sound recommendations 
* Experience in working with businesses of various sizes, including national or international
* Experience in presenting pitches/proposals and reports to internal team and clients at all levels of seniority

## About Time Out Group plc
Time Out Group is a global media and hospitality business that inspires and enables people to explore and enjoy the best of the city.

It all began in London in 1968 when Time Out helped people discover the exciting new urban cultures that had started up all over the capital. Since then, this iconic brand has consistently maintained its status as the go-to source of inspiration for both locals and visitors alike.

Time Out Media’s digital and physical media proposition comprises websites, mobile, social media, print and live events. Since its launch 50 years ago, Time Out has become a global brand that advertisers and consumers love and trust.

Time Out Market is a food and cultural market leveraging the Time Out brand to bring the best of the city under one roof: its best chefs, drinks and cultural experiences – based on the editorial curation Time Out has always been known for. Time Out Group has been named International Brand of the Year 2021 by Campaign – awarding bravery, editorial innovation and forward thinking. While Time Out Market won the Most Innovative Food & Beverage Concept Award at the Global RLI (Retail & Leisure International) Awards 2021.

Across both business divisions, the Group’s mission is to help people around the world go out better.

## About the job
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s UX leaders help define and drive the future of Google design. They create and clarify product strategy, conceptualize UX ecosystems in ways that mitigate complexity, and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. They possess a clear vision of the future of user experience and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.

You are a thoughtful team leader, manager, systems-level design thinker, and visionary - with strong instincts and outstanding intuition informed by user needs and insights. You'll be responsible for guiding the careers of your team members, working closely with each of them to help them realize their full potential.

You’ll collaborate with leaders of other UX, Engineering, and Product Management teams to create innovative experiences across all of Google’s products, leveraging your passion for brand, craft, and design quality.
User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

## Job Description
We're the UK’s largest Digital, Retail and Commercial Bank with a focus on Helping Britain Prosper. We’re innovating products that help transform customer journeys – making millions of people’s lives simpler and better, all over the country, every single day. There’s never been a better time to be part of change – help us reinvent the boundaries of banking, and we’ll invest in your continued development, so you can craft your future career!

## Who are the Retail Design Team?
We help drive the future vision of Lloyds Banking Group’s retail space, which is made-up of multiple parts: 17 million active digital customers, 1,800 branches and 80 million phone calls yearly. We make sure there’s a space for all customers to feel financially supported by us: in-branch, online or over the phone.

This role sits within the Consumer Servicing design team, we focus on the design of the customer experience for the mobile app and secure website across multiple brands for our customers day to day banking needs

As a UX Researcher, you’ll play a vital role in ensuring all design work builds a cohesive overall Lloyds Banking Group experience.

## About the role
As a talented design researcher, you'll lead the research strategy within your team in Servicing. You’ll be part of a multi-disciplinary design and product team, delivering research to unlock new opportunities and decide what features to build.

You’ll work alongside an experienced bunch of designers and product folks, sometimes engineers. We’ll value your strength in collaborating and influencing. You’ll have the chance to carry out exploratory research to discover customer needs and pain points and to understand the target audience.

As a team of researchers, we’re always experimenting and growing our techniques. Right now, we’re thinking about how we grow our accessibility research to support accessible design, and we’re doing more research with vulnerable customers. We’re looking for someone who wants to experiment and share your learnings with the team.

## What do we need from you
* Proven experience creating research plans to address product/service development questions
* Ability to help design and product teams identify and prioritise the key customer questions
* Deep qualitative research experience including depth interviews, diary studies, contextual inquiry, concept testing, usability testing
* An understanding of quantitative research, for example experience with simple surveys, click tests and card sorts
* Experience of collaboratively engaging teams in research
* Demonstrate your influence on product development decisions - to be based on customer-evidence
* A growth mentality – you experiment to enhance how we do research

## What we like…
* Quantitative research experience, for example strong experience in survey design
* Ethnographic experience
* Experience with accessibility research
* Experience coaching or mentoring researchers and designers

## About the job
At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." User Experience Researchers (UXRs) make this possible.

User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers who care deeply about the people who use our products. We play an integral part in gathering insights about product user needs, attitudes, emotions, and behaviors to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other, engineering, and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for our users and Google’s businesses.

As a User Experience Researcher (UXR), you’ll help your team of UXers, product managers, and engineers understand user needs. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. Working with stakeholders across functions and levels, you'll have impact at all stages of product development. You’ll explore user behaviors and motivations by conducting primary research such as field studies, interviews, diary studies, participatory workshops, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis.

The UXR community at Google is unique and will help you do your best work. You’ll have the opportunity to work with and learn from UXRs across Google through regular meetups, mentor programs, and access to internal research tools.

This role will focus on Fitbit’s activity feature, driving one of our leading experiences. Going beyond steps, Fitbit now provides more integrated guidance for our users. With a focus on digital behavior interventions to help users to achieve their wellness goals, this role will help cross-functional stakeholders transform health-evidence into a meaningful and impactful user experience.

Fitbit’s diverse line of innovative products of smartwatches, trackers and smart scale help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their health and fitness goals. Our products deliver personalized experiences, insights and guidance through leading software and interactive tools to support our users’ health and wellness. Partnering with Google will expand our resources and global platform, and we will be able to accelerate innovation in the wearables category to scale faster, and make health even more accessible to everyone.

* Package insights into design tools and assets for product managers and designers to leverage (e.g., personas, design principles, scenarios, etc.).
* Support project team members in transforming research findings and insights into innovative design solutions, through multiple design cycles.

## About The Role
Design is at the core of the Product team. Our designers are involved in every aspect of the product design process, from brainstorming gnarly problems to tweaking pixels before launch. We are curious, tenacious, open-minded and creative problem solvers. This role will see you working as part of a cross-functional, collaborative product team. We know that designers come in many different flavours and acronyms but above all, we’re looking for:

* A confident steward of a hypothesis-driven, iterative product design process.
* Collaborative facilitators who bring teams together to collaborate over the problem solving process.

We’re looking for a steward of the product development process. You have proven experience working in teams that use product development methodologies to solve complex problems. You’re able to articulate to your team and clients why these methodologies are integral to product development and can evidence how you’ve applied the most suitable activities from these methodologies to the problem at hand. We’re looking for collaborative facilitators. You treasure collaboration, continually looking for opportunities to harness the full potential of everyone on your team, regardless of their role. You use workshops as a means of unpacking, aligning and exploring solutions to product opportunities.

We’re looking for detail-focused craftspeople. You are passionate about building the best possible experience for our customers. Principally responsible for designing, planning and conducting user research, including methods such as: ethnographic field studies, remote testing, competitive evaluations, participatory design sessions, surveys, heuristic evaluations, and other approaches based on need. ## Mission
Bonnet’s mission is to fight climate change by accelerating the uptake of sustainable transport. We want to become the largest and most reliable network of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations in the world and put ‘range anxiety’ to bed. Through software alone, we turn every public and private charging location into an accessible and simple charge point that any driver can use.

## Background
EV sales are growing 150% every year and charger installations are expanding at a similar rate. The problem today is that chargers are difficult to find, have non-intuitive payments and are confusing to use. 

Bonnet is a startup that is looking to flip the EV charging experience on its head. Backed by Tier 1 VCs and Porsche, the company is looking to bring some customer-centricity and new technologies to the EV charging sector. The app is a one-stop-shop for EV charging, allowing drivers to see, route to and pay for all types of chargers. A single Bonnet account can be used with any charging station and features such as smart route-planning and easy payments simplify the whole experience.

## Tasks
This is an opportunity to build something from the ground up. As a young and quickly-growing startup in a nascent market, we create new technologies for our customers and are looking for creative minds to join our team. It is a great way to learn about a rapidly expanding industry (wink wink Tesla) and become an expert and pioneer in a vital sector of the future. 

We will provide you with all necessary guidance for you to learn on the job in an enthusiastic and fast-paced environment. The role will provide you with very flexible working and no face time. For a company of such a size, it is a relatively senior position as you will be one of the early employees with the potential for quick career progression. You will be working directly under our CEO in a high-responsibility role, working on delivering the most user-friendly products to our customers. 

In this role you will:

* Be fully responsible for the ongoing design of Bonnet’s native iOS and Android apps
* Craft customer journeys throughout every element of their journey with Bonnet to reduce friction and improve UX
* Illustrate ideas through storyboards, process flows, etc.
* Develop product roadmap based on customer feedback and internal data
* Gathering and evaluating user requirements in collaboration with developers
* Work closely with product developers to introduce new features and maintain/improve existent features
* Create a consistent/standardised brand image to be used across all company products and materials 
* Probably many other things that we aren’t even aware of since that’s how startup life goes!

## Requirements
* Experience in designing mobile apps
* Understanding how every pixel and button contributes to the high-level picture
* Independent worker, taking ownership of own work stream and projects
* Super creative individual who can come up with ideas; borrow from other verticals and sectors
* Knowledge and industry experience of prototyping tools. We use Figma, but are open to whatever you prefer
* Comfortable with all phases of design: Empathise, Define (the problem), Ideate, Prototype, and Test
* Interest in how your work is developed, striving to understand as much as you can about front and back-end development, and see yourself as extension of the engineering team
* Working proficiency and communication skills in English
